story:
Summary

PICK WITH AUSTIN is a 501c3 certified nonprofit foundation that operates in the memory of Texas teen guitarist, Alan Curley.

The purpose and mission of PICK WITH AUSTIN is to help educate and elevate a community awareness about the dangers of depression as it contributes to potential thoughts of suicide, particularly in young people.

We use Alan's Gift of Music to draw attention and to enhance this awareness. We provide donated guitars to kids and teens in hospitals, in youth groups and ministries, and/or to those who have been identified in some way of being potentially "at risk" of depression.

What We Need & What You Get

We have been offered the opportunity to participate in an Incubator Program, which would provide us a location - but there is a cost.  We are seeking to raise 1 year's worth of the rent cost and to cover the costs of this fund raising program.  

The location is on Main Street in downtown Round Rock, two buildings down from the public library.  It is an ideal space for us and will assist us in solidifying our presence in Williamson County, which is our key focus area.  

The actual cost to us would be $150 a month, which would provide us an office, use of facilities (including conference room), and access to password controlled WiFi.

Your donation of any size will benefit us to achieve our goal to participate in the Incubator Program and obtain an office location, and you will be provided a receipt valid as a donation you can apply to your tax deductions.

The Impact

As we grow our outreach programs, we need to position ourselves in such a way that we can go after funding through public and private, as well as government sponsored grants.  

We have just expanded our Board of Directors to include a Board of Director's Advisory Committee. This new board includes professionals in the business and mental health care industries.  We are poised to grow and to continue our work in Williamson County, and then beyond.  

The eventual goal we have is to support the entire country with our unique "Alan's Gift of Music" guitar program.  Beyond just giving guitars to at-risk youth, we want to expand into the military community, provide guitar lessons, and even build and teach youth to build our own line of guitars.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link with everyone you know.  Throw it up onto your Twitter or Facebook.  Tell your friends.  Let your employer know, in case they have a donation match program.  Beyond donating, learn about Suicide Prevention and help take the suicide topic out of the closet so that more attention can be paid in communities, churches, and schools, to awareness and prevention.

story:
Summary

Imagine 8 months with a debilitating disease, the fear of not knowing what you have, while being treated for a variety of potential diseases including surgery for cancer, when all along it was Valley Fever, unimaginable!

How could this laboratory test help patients? (potentially you, your family, friends, neighbors or pets)

  • Rapid and accurate diagnosis of Valley Fever
  • Earlier diagnosis leads to earlier effective treatment
  • Earlier diagnosis reduces misdiagnosis and mistreatment of Valley Fever
  • Earlier diagnosis reduces treatment costs due to earlier intervention

How will your contribution be used?

  • To perform testing required for FDA clearance for human use
  • To perform testing required for approval for veterinary use

Valley Fever is primarily a respiratory disease prevalent in Central and Southern Arizona as well as in the San Joaquin Valley of California.  Two thirds of all cases occur in the Phoenix Tucson corridor.  If you live in either of these areas you are likely familiar with the disease because you have had it, know somebody that has had it, or have had a pet that has contracted the disease.  In addition, given the large number of people that come to Arizona and California for the winter months and return to other parts of the US and Canada, Valley Fever cases are seen throughout the US and Canada. Valley Fever is caused by a fungus which is found in the soil and is inhaled when it becomes airborne.  For those who are infected, the disease can be highly debilitating (fatigue, cough, chest pain, fever, rash, headache and joint aches), particularly if not diagnosed early in the disease process.  Because these symptoms are not exclusive to Valley Fever, accurate laboratory tests are important to diagnosing Valley Fever.

Unfortunately, given the small geography and population that is affected by the disease it is commercially unattractive for large companies to focus on developing products for this disease, either diagnostics or treatment.  As a result there are no good diagnostics for Valley Fever leading to an average time from the first visit to the doctor with symptoms to diagnosis of on average 5 months according to the AZ Department of Health.  During this 5 month period, Valley Fever is often misdiagnosed, and mistreated as other diseases, such as pneumonia and lung cancer, resulting in added suffering and progression of the disease to greater severity.

PathoGene has developed a diagnostic test that testing to date has shown is  accurate and rapid and can diagnosis Valley Fever infections by looking at the DNA of the fungus.  The test could shorten the time to diagnosis, improve the accuracy and rapidity of diagnosis and as a result improve the treatment of Valley Fever, reducing the pain and suffering of those that acquire the disease.

The test is performed on a new portable molecular diagnostic instrument developed by DxNA, the GeneSTAT® System™ , that provides test results in 60 minutes and will allow testing to be performed:  Anywhere, Anytime, by Anybody

The GeneSTAT has been designed to bring the accuracy and speed advantages of DNA based testing closer to the patient by providing for testing in community hospitals and smaller local healthcare facilities.

Why indiegogo

Given the limited commercial market opportunity for the test, traditional funding sources for developing products for Valley Fever are not available.  As a result, DxNA is looking for support in performing the clinical study and submitting for FDA clearance of the assay through crowdfunding from individuals in the affected communities to benefit the citizens and their pets in those affected communities.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised under this project will be used to perform the clinical studies necessary to submit for regulatory clearance from the FDA.  Once FDA clearance is received the  test will be clinically available so that patients can begin realizing the benefits of an accurate and rapid diagnosis and earlier appropriate treatment. 

The Impact

This is a unique opportunity to support and improve healthcare in your local community in a way that will likely have a direct impact on you, your family or your friends and neighbors if you are a resident in the affected geography in Arizona or California, an impact that is not likely to happen without community support from people like you. It is an opportunity to make a big impact with your dollars in your local community whether it is a $15 or a $150,000 contribution to this Valley Fever Diagnostic Project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to contribute or not, please help spread the word about this project and the direct impact that it can have on their friends, family and neighbors  lives in Arizona and California.

story:
Short Summary

This February, I will be traveling with a team of eleven Orthotics and Prosthetics Graduate students from Northwestern University to Guatemala for a week long volunteer effort with the community of Zacapa, Guatemala. We will be working with The Range of Motion Project (ROMP) who has fully staffed clinical sites in Guatemala and Ecuador. Our days will consist of clinical evaluations of patients, fabricating prostheses (artificial limbs) and orthoses (walking braces), educating patients on proper wear and care of their prosthetic and orthotic devices and most importantly giving the individuals in this community the opportunity to walk once again and improve their daily lives. The video above highlights a trip from a previous group of volunteers. This is the same clinic I will be working at with the same population. Without the help of volunteer teams like ourselves working with the ROMP team, these patients in need would not be able to receive the specialized care they require to return to fully functioning status in their communities.

What We Need 

ROMP is a non-profit organization that provides free orthotic and prosthetic care to people living with amputations and other physical disabilities in developing countries, where such services are not readily available. ROMP operates a full-time clinic in Zacapa, Guatemala, but relies upon trained volunteers from around the world to provide the specialized care that these patients require.  

All of the funds raised from this effort will be used to support my trip to this clinic in February. During the course of this trip, we will provide devices to a multitude of patients, imparting them with the lasting mobility and independence they need to lead a productive life and provide for their families far into the future. Your donations will help to cover:

  • Volunteer Transportation Costs
  • Clinical Operating Costs
  • Lodging for Volunteers
My goal of $1,500 will cover my volunteer fee to ROMP as well as my transportation costs. Any extra money raised through this campaign will be donated directly to ROMP to help fund their efforts of providing care to those in need throughout the world.

The Impact

In a culture stricken with poverty and violence, the need for prosthetic and orthotic care is overwhelming. With an underdeveloped health care system, many individuals living in Guatemala do not have access to even the most basic health care. The Range of Motion Project provides free prosthetic and orthotic care to individuals in underprivileged areas that are desperately in need.

ROMP operates regardless of religious or political affiliation. ROMP recognizes the hardship of living in poverty without a prosthetic or orthotic device and understands how important these devices are to those who do not have access to them. In many cases, a prosthetic or orthotic device is a critical component in a disabled person's rehabilitation. With this "tool", independence, involvement in community and mobility in the socio-economic structure can become more attainable. Rehabilitation has the power to show that "disability" is only as crippling as the barriers we let stand in our minds and in our world. Together, with the help of trained prosthetists and orthotists, care givers, volunteers and generous donors, ROMP's vision of offering independence and hope to countless individuals is becoming a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that a monetary donation is not in everyone's best interest. If you would like to help out the cause in any other way, please feel free to share this campaign with others and visit the ROMP website for more ideas to get involved: 

http://rompglobal.org/whatyoucando.html

STAKK'D Trial Pack gets you three STAKK'D Pakks shipped to your front door. Price Includes U.S. shipping. Please add $15 for International shipping.



*Please send your name, email address, and size of the STAKK'D® apparel you would like to receive to: PleaseMixResponsibly@gmail.com






 


STAKK'D 4 LIFE gets you a six month supply of our STAKK'D Pakks* including our custom blender bottle with our limited edition t-shirt, tank top and hat. You will also receive a lifetime membership for wholesale pricing on our STAKK'D Pakks through our website. 


*Shipping is included in the price for U.S. orders. Please add $200 for International Shipping. Choose between 6 monthly shipments or one bulk shipment on your six month supply. 

*Please send your name, email address, and size of the apparel you would like to receive to: PleaseMixResponsibly@gmail.com

















                                


                                                                www.stakkd.com





There are many ways to contribute! Even if you don't have the money right now, you can  still win cool stuff. 
HOW IT WORKS
Simply log in to Indiegogo if you have not already, or create an account by signing up here. Be sure to use the same account you used when you claimed your PERK! Then, visit this STAKK'D Indiegogo Page and look below the main video to share and copy your URL.  Click here for all the details.







www.stakkd.com

story:
With the rise of child kidnapping and people gone missing, we have come with an idea to build a phone with a tracker on for you to know where they are and if they are safe.


The official launch price will be 99.99$. 
Indiegogo crowd MEGA DISCOUNT. if you were not here for us, we would not be here too. this is our special thank you for YOU guys.


For EVERY Kawai Watch Phone that is sold, 8$ goes for Cancer Cause on any project you vote amongst 3 that we will choose on indiegogo itself. 

                         1 Campaign, 2 Funding.


2 years Warranty on EVERY KAWAI WATCH. Return & Refund. No question asked. 


Key Specifications/Special Features:

Size (LxWxH): 53*39.8*12.8mm

Display: 1.54-inch capacitive touch panel 240*240 screen

CPU/solution: MTK6250 

Memory: RAM 1GB + ROM 2GB  

Pedometer: supported

Loss-resistant alarm: supported

Application: BT, BT MP3, stopwatch, alarm clock, remote camera, calendar, calculator, world time, exchange

Contract : NO

Unlocked : YES

Dual Sim : YES

Monthly fees : NO

Subscription fee : NIL

Bluetooth sync: un-connection (with smartphone) notice, able to check

Waterproof : YES 

GPS Tracking : supported

Internet Lock : supported

5.0 MP camera : supported

Zenon Flash : supported

Google PlayStore : Supported

SecretListener : application supported (free for who need it; will personally send to your email)

Fingerprint lock screen : application supported (free for who need it)

Battery: 420mAh


Special Security : 

The Fingerprint lock screen is an application which will allow a user to lock the "phone mode" and display their watch as a typical normal watch. Keep your finger pressed on the screen for 4 seconds and the phone mode will be unlocked.

We have added one more specs. a nano micro chip inside the watch for parents to be able to hear what your child is hearing. It is the SOS free call to listen to what is being broadcasted at your child's end for 90 seconds. you can call back and listen again after each 90 seconds. No need for subscriptions or useless call charge.

The information transferred through and from the watch phone is totally secure. No other device will be able to connect through it unless provided with your credentials ; password, fingerprint, Log-in

Help us spread the message. Help other parents be reassured.
Share us on social media & word-to-mouth


Every little contribution counts. As little as $1. As little as sharing the project. As simple as sharing a link

Frequent Question :

Why Indiegogo?

An additional in-built application is under development phase; 


1. Get notifications at school checkpoint or home checkpoint.

2. Be notified when your child is at one specific location for more than 2 hours.(reproggramable to any time frame you want)

3. Register your child's daily location and get notification when a different route is taken. Thus giving your child the privacy needed but keeping them safe.




Isnt the $10 Shipping fee expensive?

IF we happen to pass our GOAL, ALL shipping fee will be refunded and will be shipped for free anywhere around the world.


How do we contact you Directly?
Send any question on : 
thekawaimobile@gmail.com
We promise to reply within 48hours.

story:
So what happened?

What would you do if your long awaited vacation became the health and financial nightmare? That's what happened to my friend Marissa Gomez when she left Trinidad to visit her sister who she had not seen for several years.

Marissa had been experiencing severe stomach pains about a month before she left Trinidad, but the local hospital did not see any major problems when they ran tests, so she left on her trip feeling better and eager to relax. Two days after her arrival her intense abdominal pain returned. She tried treating it with ibuprofen however her pain got worse over the next few days, and it became so bad, that she was rushed to the nearby Emergency Department of Cleveland Clinic after suffering a week of terrible pain. There after numerous tests, doctors diagnosed that she had an abscess, and recommended a one hour procedure. When they actually started to operate, they in fact discovered that the situation was much worse. She had a perforated appendix, which led to the abscess and which had also caused a hole to form in her intestines and the one hour procedure became a five hour one to save her life.

The entire procedure and her recovery cost $45,000USD which must be paid within thirty days as this is a special “Discounted rate for non-nationals” or the cost will be raised to the full amount – over $90,000USD. Since she was discharged on 6th November, unfortunately complications have developed and they have discovered that she has excess fluid in her abdomen which is still causing her severe pain and fevers and is a source of infection and she now has to do another procedure costing $10,993.00USD. This cost they expect her to pay upfront before the surgery can take place.

As a dedicated government employee of 13 years, Marissa has always had a passion to help others. She works as a lawyer for her country. As someone who suffers from Lupus, she supports awareness campaigns and ran to raise awareness in a local half marathon though her joints were racked with pain as she ran. She gives constant care, support and financial assistance to her father, a three time cancer survivor, and her mother who recently did a knee operation and is currently going through therapeutic care. As a member of the cross fit community, Marissa regularly encourages and supports her fellow cross fitters in striving to achieve their goals and her own dedication to the support has proved to be an inspiration to many. 

Marissa understandably does not have a lot of spare funds, as her trip was to be a short and pleasant stay to enjoy the company of her family. Medical insurance is very limited and is not assisting her abroad. It is therefore devastating for her to have to pay these bills when the local exchange rate is nearly $1 USD to $7 TT. She needs help, so I hope her friends, family and people out in the world who care will offer some assistance. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Every penny we raise will go toward settling Marissa's medical bills. All contributions will be used as even a little might help ease this enormous financial burden.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but there are still ways you can help:

  • Please share this campaign with others out there who might be willing to give.
  • If you have any other ideas of how she can cover these costs, please let us know!

with ibuprofen however her pain got worse over the next few days, and it became
so bad, that she was rushed to the nearby Emergency Department of Cleveland
Clinic after suffering a week of terrible pain. There after numerous tests,
doctors diagnosed that she had an abscess, and recommended a one hour
procedure. When they actually started to operate, they in fact discovered that
the situation was much worse. She had a perforated appendix, which led to the
abscess and which had also caused a hole to form in her intestines and the one
hour procedure became a five hour one to save her life.
The
entire procedure and her recovery cost $45,000USD which must be paid within
thirty days as this is a special “Discounted rate for non-nationals” or the
cost will be raised to the full amount – over $90,000USD. Since she was
discharged on 6th November, unfortunately complications have
developed and they have discovered that she has excess fluid in her abdomen
which is still causing her severe pain and fevers and is a source of infection
and she now has to do another procedure costing $10,993.00USD. This cost they
expect her to pay upfront before the surgery can take place. 
As a
dedicated government employee of 13 years, Marissa has always had a passion to
help others. She works as a lawyer for her country. As someone who suffers from
Lupus, she supports awareness campaigns and ran to raise awareness in a local
half marathon though her joints were racked with pain as she ran. She gives
constant care, support and financial assistance to her father, a three time
cancer survivor, and her mother who recently did a knee operation and is
currently going through therapeutic care. As a member of the cross fit
community, Marissa regularly encourages and supports her fellow cross fitters
in striving to achieve their goals and her own dedication to the support has
proved to be an inspiration to many. 
Marissa
understandably does not have a lot of spare funds, as her trip was to be a short
and pleasant stay to enjoy the company of her family. Medical insurance is very
limited and is not assisting her abroad. It is therefore devastating for her to
have to pay these bills when the local exchange rate is nearly $1 USD to $7 TT.
She needs help, so I hope her friends, family and people out in the world who
care will offer some assistance. 
   What We Need & What You Get 
Every penny we raise will go toward settling Marissa's medical bills. All contributions will be used as even a little might help ease this enormous financial burden.



Other Ways You Can Help


 We know some people just can't contribute, but there are still ways you can help:  Please share this campaign with others out there who might be willing to give. If you have any other ideas of how she can cover these costs, please let us know!

Thanks so much for your help, everyone!

story:
My son's story

 

Chandler has had a rough road in life, but so many have. He lost his twin before birth, he was legally blind in one eye, and a learning disability. But, Chandler is the sweetest child. He would give anyone the shirt off of his back.

October 2011, he was assaulted by a former friend. At our local mall, the teen choked my son until he passed out, then threw him on the conrete floor. Chandlers chin  hit the floor first, splitting 9 teeth.

No one came to his aid.

Finally, a couple of friends (?) who watched the ordeal drug him into the bathroom, unconsious. They made up a story and called me to tell me he had fallen down the stairs and was hurt. I knew of only a stairway of about 3 stairs so I wasn't too concerned at first.

When I got there, I knew it was bad. He was covered in blood. He was in and out of consciousness, spitting up blood. I got him to a local hospital.

But, instead of being taken care of , Chandler was further bullied at our local hopsital. Chandler has pink hair, or he had it at the time. He dyed it pink to support Breast Cancer Awareness. Again though, it was assumed it was just because he was gay.

When the nurse saw Chandler, he immediately asked me what drugs he was on. I was floored. I asked him why did he think that. He snickered and said "well, look at his hair and he is black". Due to his instant judgement, Chandler's treatment that night was abysmal. Chandler never received anything for his pain. I begged them to do a drug test so they could see that he was not on anything.

Finally, after receiving the diagnosis, I went to the restroom. I came back, he had been released to the care of his 14 year old girlfriend, who signed the release. I asked the nurse why she did that and she said becasue she didn't think he had a mother.

So, being bi-racial and having pink hair obviously makes what happened to him okay in the staff that night. I still to this day can't believe it.

But, Chandler needs dental implants that cost about 3500 each. He needs 9 of them. The spacers he needs are 2k each. My insurance covers 1500 a year.

My son is now homeschooled. He had been bullied for years but had stuck it out. But this situation did something to him.

He is angry and sad. There has been no justice for him. He has lost weight because he can't eat the way he used to. He looks different in the face. I just want him to have a chance at being a normal teen. Something taken away from him by a kid. Why did this kid do this? He asked Chandler if his girlfriend was cheating on him and Chandler told him yes. So, he took it out on Chandler.

Please, if anyone can help, we would appreciate it. Our dentist in Springfield, Mo is Dr George Arquitt if anyone needs to verify. The office phone number is
417-887-8800.

Thank you

 

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The run is complete and we still need more funds. Thank you so much to everyone who helped us with the 5k run. Whether you can donate $5.00, $50.00, $500.00 or $5,000, all amounts are appreciated 

Fund raising Fun Run to aid Melanie Christian with mounting medical bills. Melanie Christian was diagnosed with a very aggressive form of Breast Cancer in Sept 2011. She was accepted into a Research Program at UNC Chapel Hill and has almost completed the treatment regimen: 5 months of weekly Chemotherapy, Mastectomy, and 5 weeks of daily Radiation.  In the fall, she will have 2 or 3 more surgeries for reconstruction.  The great news is that Melanie had a "total response" to the treatments and the cancer is GONE!!!  And so are the funds!!!!!  Melanie is blessed to be employed by TD Bank and has been provided very good insurance coverage.  However, her portion of the medical expenses is still staggering. Melanie is a single mom of two gorgeous girls - Cade and Cole.

She has had as much fun with cancer as you can possibly have.  She has used her hair loss as an excuse to rock a Mullet for a while then shave it and let her daughters' first and third grade classes paint on her head.  Her faith and positive attitude during this journey have been unfaltering.  She has been surrounded by friends, support, and so much laughter..........

story:
Short Summary

Jacob Myers is an average twelve year old.  He plays video games, likes building legos, and going camping with his family.  He does not let the fact that he was diagnosed with Duchenne’s Muscular Dystrophy stop him from doing the things he loves and also helping others.  For the past several years, Jake has taken part in an annual MDA "Muscle Walk" and this year he raised the most money in his event!

But now it’s time for us to do something for Jake.  Unfortunately, he lost his ability to walk this past November.  To help Jake continue with his active life, his family needs to purchase a van and have it converted to be able to carry and transport Jake and his powerchair.

Jake comes from a family that have dedicated their lives to helping people.  His mother is a nurse and his father has been a police officer for 24 years. They are not the type to ask for help, so his father's co-workers are asking for them.

The cost of a van, with the expense of converting it to handicap-accessible - is approximately $60,000.  We are holding raffles and other events to raise money, but we know how generous the "internet world" can be.  Every dollar, even a single dollar, would be a tremendous help to this cause.

Any monies raised, even if the goal is not reached, will go towards the van. If you are not comfortable donating on-line, donations are being accepted at any TD Bank (all along the northern east-coast) in the name of "Jacob's Fund".


***On July 8th, the Gloucester County Times did a nice article on all the efforts going in to help Jake. Check it out here!!  ***
http://www.nj.com/gloucester/voices/index.ssf/2...

We know times are tough and understand if you can't donate. But please pass on the link to this page. If everyone tells all their friends and just one of their friends donate, we'll reach our goal in no time!!

Thank you for reading about Jake and thank you for your support!

story:
Hi my name is Adam I am Sophias cousin. I am trying to raise a little money to help her parents aleviate  a small portion of the expenses associated with this disease. I appreciate any help you could give. I would also like for you to keep her in your prayers.

 

Sophia was born on October 20th, 2010 .   Sophia was brought to the hospital and was orginally diagnosed with RSV. After blood tests were done she was then diagnosed with Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia ( ALL ) for short.

 

Our Sophia,
Her eyes they shine; her smile like the sun; we thank you Lord for our special little one

 

 

Update:

Sophia spiked a fever on Monday 8/6/12 around 3am. We rushed here to JDCH Oncology Dept. and soon after her 1st day she was moved to pediatric ICU. Sophia has been diagnosed with pneumonia. She is having complication with her ability to maintain proper oxygen levels and has been put on a sleep apnea machine to assist her breathing. Thank God that her fever has been put under control, it is the pneumonia and a virus called adeno virus we are concerned about now. We are reaching out to everyone...

story:
FUNDRAISER UPDATES:

To view the most recent updates about our fundriaser, Lara's prognosis, progress and more click the link below:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lara-is/x/3059846?c=activity

LARA'S STORY:

When Lara was diagnosed with cataracts, which is extremely rare for someone her age, she was told she would need surgery within about a year before she would be considered legally blind. That was exactly one year ago. Her insurance plan doesn't cover vision, and she is unable to afford the surgery on her own, she has tried everything: she's contacted insurance companies, but they wouldn't cover her pre-existing condition; government health programs (Medical/Medicare/HWLA), but she didn't meet the qualifications; non-profit organizations (Mission Cataract USA/Lions Eye), she's still working on this but so far no luck and she's running out of time! Day by day Lara's eyesight is deteriorating. With no other options, Lara has contacted surgeons in the US, Mexico, and Thailand searching for the most affordable and safe option - this is where you and our Indiegogo fundraiser come in. We can't let Lara go blind! Cataracts are completely correctable, and we need your help to raise money for Lara's cataract surgery. We're committed to raising $14,000 so Lara can get surgery in the USA and our beautiful friend can continue to share her view of the world. All amounts help! Please pass this on and give the gift of sight!

A NOTE FROM LARA:

First and foremost, I want to thank everyone who has helped to create this video and fundrasing campaign.  Much love and gratitude to all of you for volunteering your time, talent, skills and expertise.  You're my heros! 

I'd also like to express my gratitude and thanks in advance to everyone who supports, shares and/or contributes to this fundraiser in any way.  My heartfelt thanks to you for taking the time to care and for giving me hope for a brighter, and clearer, future. 

I've become so accustomed to not being able to see well that I can't quite imagine what it will be like to see clearly again.  To be able to read a book (or read anything without a magnifying glass), create art, play my guitar, read music, make jewelry, feel comfortable driving my car or riding my bike again, these are all things that are easy to take for granted until you can't do them anymore.  Losing my eyesight has meant losing the ability to do things that I love; it's created challenges in performing work related tasks and even normal daily functions but it has also taught me to appreciate the simplest of things in new and profound ways. I've only just begun to fantasize about all the things I'll be able to do again after my surgery, as it's only now seeming like a reality.  And I can't wait!  Thanks to the help and support of so many wonderful people I believe that the end, and a new beginning, is indeed in sight:) With all my love and gratitude - THANK YOU!!!  xxLara

YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS

Thank you in advance for your contributions and support.  It is deeply appreciated and guaranteed to bring you good Karma:)  100% of your contribution will support Lara's cataract surgery and related expenses. 

Please Note: Lara's actual surgery is estimated to cost $12k ($6k per eye), however, we've raised our fundraising goal to $14,000 to help cover the Indiegogo processing fees and other related expenses such as loss of work during Lara's post surgery recovery, etc.

Please Note: PAYPAL payments are preferred (if possbile). Time is of the essence! Our goal is for Lara to get surgery on one eye as soon as possible. Indiegogo gives you the option to contribute via Paypal or credit card.  Paypal payments are preferred (if possbile) because contributions will be available to us within a few days so we can begin the process toward getting Lara surgery on the first eye sooner, rather than later.   You can also use a credit card on Paypal even if you don't have a Paypal account.  All non-Paypal contributions made to our Indiegogo fundraiser won't be received until two weeks after our fundraiser deadline expires. 

ABOUT LARA'S SURGERY:

Lara's doctor thinks she was probably born with cataracts and it just took time for them to materialize.  Cataracts are often hereditary and Lara's sister was born with a congenital cataract, which has left her blind in one eye since childhood.  Lara's father also has cataracts so you can basically do the math.  In any case, the good news is that cataracts are now 100% correctible so Lara is lucky in that regard.  But, the fact that Lara has cataracts in both eyes makes her situation more challenging.  A person can function pretty darn well with one good eye, as Lara's sister has proven her whole life, but the fact that Lara has cataracts in both eyes makes surgery an absolute MUST.  At least for one eye, but she needs the surgery in both eyes.  

A NOTE ON SURGERY COSTS: $12k is the average price range we've been quoted by numerous doctors in California. An approximation of costs is all the doctors have been able to give us without personally examining Lara themselves. Typical cataract surgery costs can range between $3,800 - $7,000 per eye.  Because Lara also has an astigmatism, which must be corrected in order for the cataract surgery to work, Lara's surgery will be in the higher range. Additional related costs incurred will include the donation processing fees for Indiegogo/Paypal/Credit Cards, travel expenses (if required to travel) and loss of work during the post surgery recovery time. (Recovery time can vary between 1 week to 30 days and each eye has to be operated on seperately so Lara could be in recovery for as little as 2 weeks or as much as 60 days.)

Ultimately, our goal is to raise the full $14k so that Lara will be able to get her surgery in the USA.  Our plan is to identify two or three doctors that we've been referred to and try to negotiate the best price we can get.  Plan B would mean Lara would have to get surgery in Mexico or Thailand.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Donations, donations, donations!  All amounts help! You can also help us by spreading the word.  Please pass this on and help give Lara the gift of sight!

Also, if you or someone you know has recently had successful cataract surgery please let us know.  We’d love to get more recommendations for doctors/surgeons, especially in the southern California area, but Lara is willing to travel, if necessary, to get the surgery.

THE “PERKS”

Please Note:  A voucher will be emailed to you and you can claim your Perk Package (and choose your candle scents, etc.) directly from Lara’s website.

PERK PACKAGES #4 - #12 include products from Lara's company, Reciprocity Productions, and her hand crafted product line of jewelry, soy candles and natural and organic skin care products. Detailed descriptions of the products offered in the Perk Packages are below or for more information you can visit her website:  www.reciprocityproductions.com

HAND CRAFTED WIRE WRAPPED RINGS

Hand crafted wire wrapped rings with semi-precious stones or vintage beads, made with love by Lara.

Due to her loss of vision, Lara hasn't been able to design jewelry for more than a year now, with the exception of her rings.  They're bohemian chic, classic, funky and gorgeous.  You'll get to choose from a variety of semi-precious stones and vintage beads wrapped in gold or silver wire and made to size. Perfect for men and women.

HAND CRAFTED 100% SOY FRAGRANCE CANDLES

Non-GMO & USA Produced Soy 

Clean Burning - Long Burning - Biodegradable - Eco-Friendly

100% soy with botanical and fine fragrance oils.  Scents include: Citrus Bliss, French Vanilla, Red Currant, Gardenia, Cucumber Mint and Pomegranate Sage.

HAND CRAFTED 100% SOY AROMATHERAPY CHAKRA CANDLES

Non-GMO & USA Produced Soy

Clean Burning - Long Burning - Biodegradable - Eco-Friendly

Lara's collection of Chakra Candles are made with 100% soy, blended with botanical and pure essentail oils, which correlate with each of the seven chakra energy centers.

FACE BUTTER (Nature's Botox & Wrinkle Repair)

All Natural - Wild Harvested -  Vegan

An indulgence your skin will thank you for.  Skin Revolution Face Butter is Nature's Botox and Wrinkle Repair all in one.  A deeply nourishing nighttime treatment that naturally relaxes facial muscles, provides superb wrinkle repair and prevention, hydrates and plumps skin and much more. Our proprietary blend of naturally refined Shea Butter infused with botanical and pure essential oils will amaze you.  It's what your skin has been waiting for and our customers’ even say "It's Revolutionary."  

FACE CREME (Nature's Botox & Wrinkle Repair)

Certified Organic Contents - Certified Vegan

Skin Revolution's Organic Face Creme is Nature's Botox & Wrinkle Repair all in one (Day Creme)  and it's simply divine. It’s what your skin has been dreaming of.  Organic Aloe, Shea Butter, Jojoba, Evening Primrose, Rooibos Tea Extract and DMAE combine to naturally relax facial muscles,  provide superb wrinkle repair and prevention and have a soothing and restorative effect on the skin. Pure essential oils provide additional skin healing benefits. 

Rooibos is a powerful player in the team of antioxidants this crème brings to your skin.  Recent scientific studies have found that rooibos tea contains a mimic of the enzyme Super Oxide Dismutase (S.O.D.) which is an antioxidant that attacks the free radicals and limits their damaging effects on the skin.

NATURALLY REFINED SHEA BUTTER

All Natural - Wild Harvested - Vegan

Reciprocity Productions shea butter is naturally refined using only water, steam and the sun.  It's off-white in color and has a very smooth texture (just like butter). Infused with our proprietary blend of pure essential oils which provide additional skin healing benefits and a light citrus lavender aroma with a slight woodsy undertone.
    
African healers have used shea butter for thousands of years as the ideal treatment for dry or aging skin. Reknowned for its anti-wrinkle properties, its high content of non-saponifiable fatty acids gives it the ability to moisturize and retain the elasticity of the skin, it's also loaded with vitamins A, E and F that nourish the skin. Shea butter has a natural SPF and protects the skin against the damaging effects of the sun while repairing cellular degeneration.

ORGANIC BODY LOTION (Pink Grapefruit or Lavender)

Certified Organic Contents - Vegan

Skin Revolution Organic Body Lotion is wonderfully luscious and deeply moisturizing.  The ultimate body lotion for everyone! 

LAVENDER: Lavender distillate and Lavender essentail oil are combined to create the perfect lotion for sensitive skin.  Our Lavender lotion is so mild it can even be used as a baby lotion and is a natural insect repellent.

PINK GRAPEFRUIT: Pink Grapefruit is a bright, cheerful scent that makes everyone smile. A favorite of both men and women.

First and foremost, I want to thank everyone who has helped to create this video and fundrasing campaign.  Much love and gratitude to all of you for volunteering your time, talent, skills and expertise.  You're my heros! 
I'd also like to express my gratitude and thanks in advance to everyone who supports, shares and/or contributes to this fundraiser in any way.  My heartfelt thanks to you for taking the time to care and for giving me hope for a brighter, and clearer, future. 
I've become so accustomed to not being able to see well that I can't quite imagine what it will be like to see clearly again.  To be able to read a book (or read anything without a magnifying glass), create art, play my guitar, read music, make jewelry, feel comfortable driving my car or riding my bike again, these are all things that are easy to take for granted until you can't do them anymore.  Losing my eyesight has meant losing the ability to do things that I love; it's created challenges in performing work related tasks and even normal daily functions but it has also taught me to appreciate the simplest of things in new and profound ways. I've only just begun to fantasize about all the things I'll be able to do again after my surgery, as it's only now seeming like a reality.  And I can't wait!  Thanks to the help and support of so many wonderful people I believe that the end, and a new beginning, is indeed in sight:) With all my love and gratitude - THANK YOU!!!  xxLara
YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS
Thank you in advance for your contributions and support.  It is deeply appreciated and guaranteed to bring you good Karma:)  100% of your contribution will support Lara's cataract surgery and related expenses. 
Please Note: Lara's actual surgery is estimated to cost $12k ($6k per eye), however, we've raised our fundraising goal to $14,000 to help cover the Indiegogo processing fees and other related expenses such as loss of work during Lara's post surgery recovery, etc.
Please Note: PAYPAL payments are preferred (if possbile). Time is of the essence! Our goal is for Lara to get surgery on one eye as soon as possible. Indiegogo gives you the option to contribute via Paypal or credit card.  Paypal payments are preferred (if possbile) because contributions will be available to us within a few days so we can begin the process toward getting Lara surgery on the first eye sooner, rather than later.   You can also use a credit card on Paypal even if you don't have a Paypal account.  All non-Paypal contributions made to our Indiegogo fundraiser won't be received until two weeks after our fundraiser deadline expires.  
ABOUT LARA'S SURGERY:
Lara's doctor thinks she was probably born with cataracts and it just took time for them to materialize.  Cataracts are often hereditary and Lara's sister was born with a congenital cataract, which has left her blind in one eye since childhood.  Lara's father also has cataracts so you can basically do the math.  In any case, the good news is that cataracts are now 100% correctible so Lara is lucky in that regard.  But, the fact that Lara has cataracts in both eyes makes her situation more challenging.  A person can function pretty darn well with one good eye, as Lara's sister has proven her whole life, but the fact that Lara has cataracts in both eyes makes surgery an absolute MUST.  At least for one eye, but she needs the surgery in both eyes.  
A NOTE ON SURGERY COSTS: $12k is the average price range we've been quoted by numerous doctors in California. An approximation of costs is all the doctors have been able to give us without personally examining Lara themselves. Typical cataract surgery costs can range between $3,800 - $7,000 per eye.  Because Lara also has an astigmatism, which must be corrected in order for the cataract surgery to work, Lara's surgery will be in the higher range. Additional related costs incurred will include the donation processing fees for Indiegogo/Paypal/Credit Cards, travel expenses (if required to travel) and loss of work during the post surgery recovery time. (Recovery time can vary between 1 week to 30 days and each eye has to be operated on seperately so Lara could be in recovery for as little as 2 weeks or as much as 60 days.) 
Ultimately, our goal is to raise the full $14k so that Lara will be able to get her surgery in the USA.  Our plan is to identify two or three doctors that we've been referred to and try to negotiate the best price we can get.  Plan B would mean Lara would have to get surgery in Mexico or Thailand.
HOW YOU CAN HELP
Donations, donations, donations!  All amounts help! You can also help us by spreading the word.  Please pass this on and help give Lara the gift of sight!
Also, if you or someone you know has recently had successful cataract surgery please let us know.  We’d love to get more recommendations for doctors/surgeons, especially in the southern California area, but Lara is willing to travel, if necessary, to get the surgery.
THE “PERKS”
Please Note:  A voucher will be emailed to you and you can claim your Perk Package (and choose your candle scents, etc.) directly from Lara’s website.
PERK PACKAGES #4 - #12 include products from Lara's company, Reciprocity Productions, and her hand crafted product line of jewelry, soy candles and natural and organic skin care products. Detailed descriptions of the products offered in the Perk Packages are below or for more information you can visit her website:  www.reciprocityproductions.com
HAND CRAFTED WIRE WRAPPED RINGS
Hand crafted wire wrapped rings with semi-precious stones or vintage beads, made with love by Lara.
Due to her loss of vision, Lara hasn't been able to design jewelry for more than a year now, with the exception of her rings.  They're bohemian chic, classic, funky and gorgeous.  You'll get to choose from a variety of semi-precious stones and vintage beads wrapped in gold or silver wire and made to size. Perfect for men and women.
HAND CRAFTED 100% SOY FRAGRANCE CANDLES
Non-GMO & USA Produced Soy 
Clean Burning - Long Burning - Biodegradable - Eco-Friendly
100% soy with botanical and fine fragrance oils.  Scents include: Citrus Bliss, French Vanilla, Red Currant, Gardenia, Cucumber Mint and Pomegranate Sage.

HAND CRAFTED 100% SOY AROMATHERAPY CHAKRA CANDLES
Non-GMO & USA Produced Soy
Clean Burning - Long Burning - Biodegradable - Eco-Friendly
Lara's collection of Chakra Candles are made with 100% soy, blended with botanical and pure essentail oils, which correlate with each of the seven chakra energy centers.

FACE BUTTER (Nature's Botox & Wrinkle Repair)
All Natural - Wild Harvested -  Vegan
An indulgence your skin will thank you for.  Skin Revolution Face Butter is Nature's Botox and Wrinkle Repair all in one.  A deeply nourishing nighttime treatment that naturally relaxes facial muscles, provides superb wrinkle repair and prevention, hydrates and plumps skin and much more. Our proprietary blend of naturally refined Shea Butter infused with botanical and pure essential oils will amaze you.  It's what your skin has been waiting for and our customers’ even say "It's Revolutionary."  
FACE CREME (Nature's Botox & Wrinkle Repair)
Certified Organic Contents - Certified Vegan
Skin Revolution's Organic Face Creme is Nature's Botox & Wrinkle Repair all in one (Day Creme)  and it's simply divine. It’s what your skin has been dreaming of.  Organic Aloe, Shea Butter, Jojoba, Evening Primrose, Rooibos Tea Extract and DMAE combine to naturally relax facial muscles,  provide superb wrinkle repair and prevention and have a soothing and restorative effect on the skin. Pure essential oils provide additional skin healing benefits.  Rooibos is a powerful player in the team of antioxidants this crème brings to your skin.  Recent scientific studies have found that rooibos tea contains a mimic of the enzyme Super Oxide Dismutase (S.O.D.) which is an antioxidant that attacks the free radicals and limits their damaging effects on the skin.
NATURALLY REFINED SHEA BUTTER
All Natural - Wild Harvested - Vegan
Reciprocity Productions shea butter is naturally refined using only water, steam and the sun.  It's off-white in color and has a very smooth texture (just like butter). Infused with our proprietary blend of pure essential oils which provide additional skin healing benefits and a light citrus lavender aroma with a slight woodsy undertone.    African healers have used shea butter for thousands of years as the ideal treatment for dry or aging skin. Reknowned for its anti-wrinkle properties, its high content of non-saponifiable fatty acids gives it the ability to moisturize and retain the elasticity of the skin, it's also loaded with vitamins A, E and F that nourish the skin. Shea butter has a natural SPF and protects the skin against the damaging effects of the sun while repairing cellular degeneration. 
ORGANIC BODY LOTION (Pink Grapefruit or Lavender)
Certified Organic Contents - Vegan
Skin Revolution Organic Body Lotion is wonderfully luscious and deeply moisturizing.  The ultimate body lotion for everyone! 
LAVENDER: Lavender distillate and Lavender essentail oil are combined to create the perfect lotion for sensitive skin.  Our Lavender lotion is so mild it can even be used as a baby lotion and is a natural insect repellent.
PINK GRAPEFRUIT: Pink Grapefruit is a bright, cheerful scent that makes everyone smile. A favorite of both men and women.

story:
Hello, my name is Lance. I'm 44 years old, I'm a composer, producer and artist as well as a full-time jack of many trades (including retail presently), master of a few. I call this video, "I Want to LIVE: Busking for Health", because I used to busk (entertain for donations) in the NYC subways... and now I shall do it on the internet to earn monetary donations for my health care costs.

I have treatable cancer. I am uninsured and need your help.

Why do I need your help? Because our household income is much too high to qualify for things like Medicaid/Medicare and way too low for me to afford private insurance in addition to costs of mere survival otherwise. My wife's group through her employer is quite small and therefore unaffordable for me as well. I will have to wait approximately another 10 months to enroll in my own employer's group which is quite substandard insurance to begin with.... I don't have time to spare.

Additionally, there are 'pre-existing conditions' which hinder securing health insurance. Again, I've already been diagnosed with a type of cancer which is completely treatable providing I'm able to find financing and get treatment SOON - like YESTERDAY. That's where my friends, friends of friends of friends, etc. donate what you might afford toward helping me receive timely treatment.

Here's the treatment I need (that I'm aware of so far):
-surgery on my tongue to remove malignant lesion
-reconstructive surgery
-plus all the testing, hospital admission(s), medications, and office visits.

For now, the ENT surgeon is asking for $7,000 before surgery. I will keep everybody updated and ask for funds in steps as needed (?)

So... what do YOU get out of donating to my health care costs? You get a li'l to big size piece of my body of work as a photographer, writer, composer. I swear if you people on the 'interwebs' save me, you're going to inspire me to start vlogging & entertaining you: Music, Comedy, Philosophy.... You'll have a collaborator and loyal supporter for creative and life endeavors. You'll have my eternal gratitude and I'll send special music and artwork at different levels.

For now you may check out more of what I'm about (other than being broke and diseased)... :) ...at these links:
facebook.com/lancecyrlin
https://www.facebook.com/pages/lanceKC-Zygote-P...
http://www.soundclick.com/zygoteproductions
http://www.youtube.com/user/QiSonix


Thank You, Kind Souls, Dearly! And please share this widely.
-Lance

story:
OUR STORY

Bread and Yoga was founded in 2009 with the mission of serving Inwood, a vibrant community in Northern Manhattan. With a focus on health and creative expression as a path to wellness, Bread and Yoga offers yoga, cooking and nutrition classes, art classes, community events and a comprehensive after-school program. Bread and Yoga is a small business dedicated to nurturing the vitality of its community and bringing people together.

In January of 2012 our beloved space at the corner of 207th and Broadway suffered a devastating fire destroying the studio and all its contents. Since then we’ve operated out of a temporary space at Holy Trinity Church and have stayed up and running thanks in large part to the tremendous generosity of our supporters and friends.

After 18 months of looking for a new space we will soon be ready to move into our new home at 5000 Broadway.  This is a time of reconstruction, celebration and a declaration to the Inwood community that we are here to stay!

The funds raised in this campaign will help us create a new haven, a space where we can come together, share thoughts and take a personal stake in improving ourselves and our neighborhood. Small businesses like Bread and Yoga are the heart and soul of any community and your contribution will celebrate the idea that we're truly all in it together.

A GOOD OLD FASHIONED COMMUNITY BARN RAISING!

Currently we are undergoing a major renovation of our new home at 5000 Broadway. With your help, we will be able to make the space a beautiful and welcoming haven for our Bread and Yoga family.

Your contributions will help cover:

- Permits, planning, architectural and design expenses

- The gut demolition of what was formerly a partitioned office space including eliminating drop ceilings

- A full renovation creating four separate spaces for an art studio, yoga studio, kitchen and lobby/retail area

- Refinishing floors and ceilings and installing sustainable bamboo flooring for the yoga studio

- Furniture, storage, lighting fixtures, kitchen appliances

- Bathrooms and changing areas

- A brand new yoga wall!

In the spirit of sustainability, we will be incorporating reused and refinished original materials and second hand furnishings therefore keeping our construction as green as we possibly can.

WHY? BECAUSE WE ARE ALL IN IT TOGETHER!

In its first four years, Bread and Yoga became an essential part of the community and we are committed to providing services that otherwise would not exist in Inwood. Even so, we have lots more moving and shaking to do!  The goals that come with having a new home are limitless.

This is a great opportunity to invest in the quality of life and vitality of our community. Every contributor is an essential part of our Bread and Yoga family. Your contribution is a hands on way of helping us raise this barn and our gratitude is immeasurable!

YOUR FRIENDS ARE OUR FRIENDS!

You can get your hands dirty in many ways. If you cannot make a financial contribution at this time please support us by SPREADING THE WORD ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN! Make noise, email your friends and family.  Share with them why this is important to you and why it's good for the Inwood community. The more folks who join us in the raising of this barn, the stronger our community gets. 

Indiegogo makes it super easy for you. Just use the share tools on this page to spread the word on all the social platforms as well as via your email database. 

B&Y VIDEO CREDITS: Produced and Directed by JOSH LIVERIGHT, Cinematography by QUENELL JONES, B-Roll Cinematography by CRISTOBAL VIVAR, Edited by EDUARDO DIAZ, Original Music by DAVID ELLENBOGEN, Special Thanks to TED WACHS and JONATHAN HILDEBRANDT.

story:
My Story


Hi, I am Yagmur. I was born in Gaziantep, Turkey in 1981. I am from a crowded family, have four brothers and a sister. Since early childhood, I felt that there was a disconnection between my body and soul, I saw myself as a girl but couldn't express that; my family, brothers, parents, all opposed. Families in Turkey are often quite repressive and they prize masculinity. I was introverted, I liked getting away, escaping by drawing things.

When I reached 20 years of age I still thought I was the only one who felt this way :) My parents wanted me to study agriculture in university, and although I wanted to study arts, I obliged. In the city where my university was located, I met new people and also lgbt people. Thanks to them I rediscovered myself and decided that I should set the course of my life myself. I left agriculture and took the exam for the arts department. Out of 650 applicants the department took 10 people, I placed 3rd, I was happy. 

My family was furious and my parents decided to punish me by not sending any money. While trying to study and earn money at the same time, I learned to stand on my own and got increasingly detached from my family. After graduation, I moved to Istanbul. I found out about LGBTTI associations and started to get into lgbt activism. I was trying to find work but was constantly being rejected because of my appearance. With the incentive of my friends I started doing tattoo work. I have been a voluntary activist of Istanbul LGBTT and Lambda Istanbul associations for three years. I focus on trans issues and hate crime/murders. Recently I joined up with a few trans friends and together we founded Transblog association. In Turkey being transgendered is difficult and trans people are subject to maltreatment from the society, the police and the government unfortunately.. Each year in Turkey more than 20 trans women are killed, most of them during sex work. A lot of trans women are forced into sex work as they can't find jobs. I don't want to be a sex worker nor have the courage, being trans and being a sex worker is very difficult.. Doing tattoos, I am able to only pay for my living, basic expenses, I don't earn enough for further transition. With your help, I can realize my dream of further transitioning into a woman and undergo the surgeries I need..


What I Need 

I am raising $10000 for the surgeries ahead.. I need $2500 for rhinoplasty, at least $3500 for trachea shave and vocal cord surgery, $1500 for laser hair removal and also $2500 for breast augmentation. 

You can help by clicking ''contribute now'' button on this website, no amount is too small or too large..  Also you could contribute by sharing with your friends. 


Some of my art.. Thank you for your support

story:
Support Coach Lisa Morgan's dream to run the ING New York City Marathon! 

If your kid has had the good luck to be on a team led by Coach Morgan - then you know the power of her touch.  Coach Morgan truly transforms kids’ lives.

Coach Morgan combines pure positive energy and encouragement, with relentless pushing.  And, she has real results to show for it. Columbia High School’s win last year at the Track and Field Nationals was no fluke.  It was the result of hard work and dedication.

Whether your kid finishes a race in first place or in last place - Coach Morgan keeps the focus on achieving a “PR” – personal record. When you watch the kids cross the finish line with a big smile and a sense of accomplishment that is priceless – there is no doubt about the positive impact a great coach can make.

Coach Morgan’s inclusive policy of letting anyone and everyone on the track team and cross country team is remarkable. This should be the model for all high school teams. No wonder her teams have 165+ kids. That's what I call a talent pool!

Now it is our turn to support Coach Morgan!  It has long been Lisa Morgan’s dream to run the ING New York City Marathon. She has secured a spot for this Sunday and must raise the $392 to cover the guaranteed entry fee. 

And, as if working six to seven days a week, riding her bicycle alongside the cross country team and often starting very early in the morning isn’t enough of a challenge.  Now she wants to run 26+ miles on the streets of New York to try to raise additional funds to be split evenly between the track team and the cross country teams.  This
is her own “PR” (personal record).

I hope you will join me in supporting her. Your support is proof positive that you know the wisdom of a great coach! I have pledged $75. I hope you can make a contribution too.  No amount is too small or too large. The first $392 is for her entry fee and the remaining will be evenly split between the Columbia Track and Field and Cross Country teams. 

And if you can’t give money – just send her your well wishes… that is also appreciated. Your support, no matter how big or small, is a vote for the great sport of running and for the students who give it their all. 

Finally, If you know anybody who has been touched by Coach
Morgan please share this request.  She is a star and deserves our generosity. 

I thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Katherine DeFoyd

AKA Grateful Mother of a "back of the pack cross country team member" who finishes every race feeling like a star!

PS I will sweeten the pot. For all donors – email me your guess on Coach Morgan's finish time and whom ever comes closest to the actual time – I will get  you four (4) finish line tickets to the 2014 New York City Marathon for next year.

story:
Our journey:

Hello, My name is Jay Trice, my fiancé and I are the founders and owners of JAWS Hydroponics. We are a small home based business in Atlanta, Ga. that supplies accessible, affordable and efficient indoor garden cabinets and supplies.

I am a L-1 paraplegic and bilateral amputee, who loves reading, writing, the outdoors and gardening.  Unfortunately due to my disability and location, maintaining a garden outside is virtually impossible. So my fiancé and I set out on a journey to bring our passion indoors. We first started by purchasing an Aerogarden, which worked for small herbs and the occasional tomato here and there but we wanted to grow more and also did not care for the bright light that the Aerogarden emitted in our dining room/kitchen. So after a lot of researching, frustration and trial & error we built our first indoor garden cabinet . It performed great, we were able to grow fresh strawberries that were not suppose to produce in their first season, in about 60 days!

We knew then that we were on to something. I was able to garden independently and easily in my own home. I knew if I could achieve great results with the system anyone could. The Galaxy Indoor Garden was born. We began to produce all the necessary components needed to operate the unit in our small home office. We handcrafted each cabinet  and each Oxy-Pot needed to grow hydroponically which turned our small home office into a workshop.

I then did more research and learned how to own and operate our website.  We continued to improve our design and sold a few cabinets here and there. We then tried our hand at selling on EBay, it was a great experience but the fees were really holding back our progress. So we are now trying to operate independently, continue to innovate and provide the best quality cabinet possible.

Our goals:

  • Convert our garage into a larger more accessible workshop
  • Further improve our Galaxy Indoor Gardens with a better R&D budget
  • Improve our web presence
  • Continually build our brand into the successful entity we believe it can be
  • Include ALL of our funders in our journey with email updates, live chats and videos of our progress.
  • Deliver all funders cabinets before our estimated delivery date

We want to provide everyone who has the desire to garden indoors or even people interested in a new hobby, disabled and able-bodied the opportunity to own an inexpensive, healthy and efficient way to grow their own fruits, vegetables and herbs. Thank you for taking the time to get to know us and we would really appreciate your support in our campaign.

are a small home based business in Atlanta, Ga. that supplies accessible,
affordable and efficient indoor garden cabinets and supplies.
I am a L-1 paraplegic
and bilateral amputee, who loves reading, writing, the outdoors and
gardening.  Unfortunately due to my disability
and location, maintaining a garden outside is virtually impossible. So my fiancé and I set out on a journey to bring
our passion indoors. We first started by purchasing an Aerogarden, which worked
for small herbs and the occasional tomato here and there but we wanted to grow
more and also did not care for the bright light that the Aerogarden emitted in our
dining room/kitchen. So after a lot of researching, frustration and trial &
error we built our first indoor garden cabinet . It performed great, we were

hydroponically which turned our small home office into a workshop.

story:
Our Project

I hate touching toilet seats.  I bet you do as well.

I decided to make something that fully addresses the problem of touching urine, feces, bacteria and germs that get thrown and sprayed around your toilet.

The Lift & Lower is the answer.

We have invented a quality Antimicrobial Handle with built-in Splash Guard.
We need your help to make it even better...

We already have the regular Antimicrobial Handle with Splashguard being produced. You can order TWO of those right now for just $12!  Shipped!  
Just Choose the "Lift It!" Selection. 

We are also adding a built in LED light to the handle.

  • No more being blinded in the middle of the night by your bathroom light
  • No more wondering if the seat is up or down if you use the bathroom in the middle of the night.
  • The light will stay on until the seat is lowered, encouraging the re-lowering of the seat
  • It's made of Antimicrobial material too! (which is built in and lasts the life of the product)


What We Need & What You Get

We need additional funding to implement the final stage of our first product, and the next stage of advancement for the product, adding the LED light.  The light will automatically turn on when lifted and will shut off when lowered. We will be using a built in accelerometer to determine position.  This is high-tech stuff!

  • We will be using funds for development, prototyping, tooling/machine costs and initial production run for the Lift & Lower Light

(*NOTE, there is an error in the descriptions to the right hand side, it may contain "amp;" in the description, this was caused by an HTML error when using an "&")

$12 - You will get a 2-Pack of the Lift & Lower (No light) shipped to you when the first production run is completed (June 2014)

$20 - You will get a Lift & Lower Light(built in LED) shipped to you when the design is complete and production run is completed. (Est. Nov 2014)

$30 - You will get a 2-Pack of the Lift & Lower (No light) shipped to you when the first production run is completed (June 2014) AND you will get a Lift & Lower Light (built in LED) shipped to you when the design is complete and production run is completed. (Est. Nov 2014)


Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our webpage at
www.midonindustries.com   

Like our facebook pages:
www.facebook.com/midonindustries  
www.facebook.com/liftandlower 
www.facebook.com/liftandlowerlight

story:
Heart Journey

My sister, Alexandra, is an AMAZINGLY strong and positive person.  She is so fortunate to be surrounded by a wonderful, close network of very good people who are all working hard to support her through this very tough time. You can meet her and her family on her blog.  It is also the best way to follow their story as she is great about posting updates regularly.
 
♥  Check out her BLOG.
♥  Check out her Photography Business (currently on hold).

The reason we are here - putting this fund raiser together, is because until my sister called with the news, we knew NOTHING about Congenital heart defects (CHD).  Sure, we know about the other diseases ravaging our babies, and see the various teams out there running, biking, swimming, fund raising and increasing awareness - but CHD's are America’s #1 birth defect. Nearly one of every 100 babies is born with a CHD.

Where is Team CHD???
 
Now that Macsen has been diagnosed with a rare form of CHD called Hypoplastic Left Heart Syndrome (HLHS) - we realize there just isn't enough attention or funds placed on this issue - and we plan to DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT!
 
♥  CHD are the #1 cause of birth defect related deaths.
 
♥  The cost for inpatient surgery to repair CHD exceeds $2.2 billion a year.

♥  CHD occur frequently and are often life threatening, yet research for CHD is grossly under funded.

♥  Of every dollar the government spends on medical funding only a fraction of a penny is directed toward CHD research.

♥  1 out of every 4,344 babies born in the United States each year is born with HLHS.
 

Donation Framework

We have NO IDEA what this will cost (not only in terms of $$).
 
All donated funds will go directly to the family to offset costs associated with Macsen's Heart Journey. 
 
Your donations will: 
 
♥  help pay down some of the expected medical bills (after insurance),
♥  help them keep up with current financial commitments, and
♥  allow the family some time to recover without the financial burden hanging over their heads.
 
While the anticipated cost of his three surgeries is around $3 million, I set the goal for this campaign to his due date, 15-9-12 -  $15,912 - hoping this is a feasible goal. 
 
If the worst scenario occurs, and he does not make it - (gulp) - every remaining penny donated here will go directly to support HLHS and CHD research. Every. Penny.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can’t contribute $, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Please consider:

♥  Prayer - absolutely powerful and appreciated! Specifically, we pray his tricuspid valve does not leak because that is a deal-breaker for the doctors. They won't even try to save him if that happens.  If you have words of encouragement... or advice - those are welcome too.

♥  Contact me if you can donate a "Perk" - that would be a HUGE help for us as we look for creative ideas that might help people pick our fund.  You can find me on Facebook.

♥  Buy "Miracle  Gear" for Macsen and SPREAD THE WORD ABOUT HLHS!

♥  Buy discounted Restaurant Coupons - $4.00 of every $10.00 goes directly to Macsen!

♥  Please SPREAD THE WORD! Share this with everyone you know! Use Facebook, Twitter, anything - and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your time and consideration...

story:
Community Lighting in Cambodia

Ms Sambo was exhausted after a tough day at work and walked home along the dark empty road. Suddenly, she heard some movements in the shadows and few seconds later someone attacked her from behind. She started screaming and fighting with the stranger, who tried to close her throat and pull her off the path. That night was a lucky one for her. The villagers living nearby heard her screaming and rescued her before the man could hurt her.

 

This is one of the many stories that you would hear in Kampong Chhnang Province about robberies, assaults, accidents and supernatural occurrences. Far from the electricity grid, the residents of Kampong Chhnang do their evening activities on the dark streets and rural terrain. The cost to connect the village to the country’s electricity grid goes up to millions of dollars leaving darkness as their only option. View the interview with Keo Phonn, a resident of the Kampong Chhnang Province.

Together, We Can Change Their Reality.

We founded Fosera Lighting as a Spin-Off company from the Solar Energy Research Institute of Singapore (SERIS) and decided to come up with a cheaper, long-lasting solution to address the basic need of street and community lighting. After two years of intensive research we have developed COMMLIGHT® as an independent lighting system that is easy-to-install at any location not connected by the grid.

For our first project, we are working in partnership with the NGOs BoP Hub and WTO (World Toilet Organisation) in a wholly non-profit campaign to kick-start our first production batch, wherof 75 COMMLIGHT® units will be installed under this project at the Kampong Chhnang Province.

We invite you to be a part of this journey.

  

Support us in our start-up venture through the campaign in Cambodia. By October 2013, we want to set up 75 COMMLIGHT® units along the roads of Kampong Chhnang.

COMMLIGHT® brings lighting for basic everyday needs for its residents, promoting safety in their community. Your monetary contributions could be as small as $5 or as high as $1,800, which all goes into the funding of the production and installation of the COMMLIGHT® in the villages of Kampong Chhnang.

The Locations

COMMLIGHT® will be installed in 3 villages: Kraing Learve (Health Center), Toek Laak and Trapaing Kravann. They will be placed along the roads leading to important community locations such as health centers, schools, water wells and temples. For a more detailed look at the location maps, please view our gallery.

As we install the COMMLIGHT®, we will continuously update our Google-Map with photo tags, so that you can follow the progress and easily find your personal donated light. View the active Google Map!

The Impact

Your contribution will light up their lives.

Community lighting will promote:

  • Better traffic safety on the road at cross-junctions in the villages 
  • Independence & safety for women like Sambo in Tropaing Kravann
  • Security for children going to Toek Laak Primary School early morning and possibility for playing outside in the evenings
  • Ability to access basic medical facilities after dark from the local healthcare center in Kraing Learve
  • Safety during attending the evening bath at the village well for factory and field workers in Tropaing Kravann

We Want To Thank You

Your contribution means more to us than you can imagine. To share our joy with you, we offer simple perks that can serve as a reminder of your generosity.

In our effort to ensure this experience is meaningful to you, we will be providing weekly updates to our contributors on the progress of the campaign. If you have any questions, we are available online and will respond to e-mails within 1-2 working days.

To contact us, please send your e-mails to savemyvillage@fosera-lighting.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

You are the main part for the success of this campaign!

  • Help us to spread the word  – share our page on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc. using the tools above!
  • Make some noise – tell about your contribution in your blog or newsletter and invite your friends to join!
  • Do you have a great idea on how to make this campaign a success or replicate it elsewhere to help people in need? Please write to us at savemyvillage@fosera-lighting.com

 

COMMLIGHT® by  

Fosera Lighting® Pte Ltd is a start-up initiative brought to life by its first product, COMMLIGHT®. 

COMMLIGHT® was developed by a group of international researchers when they were challenged to provide an affordable and reliable solar street and community lighting solution to areas where the electric grid is missing or unreliable.

COMMLIGHT® has completed its prototype stage and won awards for its innovation from the Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology (SMART) and INSEAD Business School.

The vision of Fosera Lighting® is to redefine rural living through increasing productivity, safety and life quality by exteding the day after sunset.

To find out more details about COMMLIGHT® please access the technical datasheet here. 

To find out more about Fosera Lighting Pte Ltd, please click here for our brochure and join us at our Facebook page

 

Our Partners
