To complete this project on Android, Apple IOS, BlackBerry OS10, Windows 8 Mobile as well as the cloud monitoring element, will cost US$93 000 in addition to what has already been invested. To date the system has been developed to the stage where it has certain prime functionalities.
A large part of the application development cost has been self-funded.  In the unlikely event that the project is not fully subscribed, there will in any case be sufficient equity to qualify for bridging finance in order to deliver a working product.
Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word amongst friends and acquaintances who might want to be involved in this extremely worthwhile project. This is technology that is truly indispensible across a broad spectrum of the community.
Should you be interested or know someone who would be interested in becoming a strategic partner/Investor, please contact me on eric@infohigh.co.za

story: I've worked among the poor of Morocco for the past 17 years . I'm a humanitarian trying to meet various needs that I encounter. I've worked in many cities in Morocco. The Southern part of Morocco is beautiful in it's desert environment including so many palm trees, endless sand and dunes and an occasional oasis. But it is the people that draws me back over and over. This next trip I will be director of a 7 person Physical Therapy team that will help ease the pain of the Saharawi People.

But it is the people that draws me back over and over. This next trip I will be director of a 7 person Physical Therapy team that will help ease the pain of the Saharawi People.

story:
Get more than just chocolate: The Perfect Fuel 

                                 This is not dessert chocolate.

The Perfect Fuel Chocolate story:

It was before the North Country Triathlon in upstate New York that Nicolas was scarfing down raw cacao and real ginseng that he wondered why there wasn’t a chocolate made with anything good for you. Ya know, one with a real benefit and not just a different flavor. Dark chocolate is already the incredible food to beat all Superfoods, and what if you could get the boost you need from something pure, organic, and delicious. I don’t believe you need to settle for little bottles of chemicals for hours of energy or pills to round out your diet. Support Perfect Fuel and this campaign so we can make chocolate good for you.  

Organic Cacao - No refined sugars, naturally gluten free, and packed with something that's actually good for you. 

Where we are today:

From our office in a co-working space called Space with a Soul, we successfully launched a small batch of our Endurance Chocolate with Ginseng. It was inspiring to see that people love healthy chocolate and wanted more! Perfect Fuel Chocolate is becoming a popular snack here in Massachusetts where we are based, and you can help make it even better.

Our community here in Boston and around the globe have been a huge help so far and we invite you to become a part of it.  We are a Youth Trade company, being entrepreneurs under 35 and engaged in the conscious capitalism conversation. Our friends and family have encouraged us on this path and we couldn't have made it this far without their support.  The outside excitement people have shown provide us the energy we need to continue.

We're about to embark on something really amazing, bringing chocolate to a whole new level as a healthy snack. We would love your help on the next leg of our journey: 3 new flavors that will take us there.  Just as we are inspired by triathletes and marathoners we would like to inspire you to be active and eat chocolate while you do it!

Miles and Nicolas - North Country Triathlon - Sharing Chocolate

Where you come in:

We've been getting requests for new varieties of Perfect Fuels and need your help to make healthy chocolate a reality.

The 3 new Fuels we would like to produce are:

  • Organic Coffee chocolate for its natural caffeine boost
  • Organic Chia for its high density of omega-3's and fiber
  • Sea Salt as a delicious recovery chocolate to replenish your electrolytes 

Your supporting funds will be put towards:

  • Polycarbonate molds for the perfect serving size
  • Compostable packaging to stay earth friendly and sustainable
  • Raw ingredients for the best natural fuel we can make. 
  • Manufacturing Perfect Fuel Chocolate

There are tons of costs that go into creating Perfect Fuel Chocolate and

                 WE NEED YOUR HELP TO BLOW OUR GOAL OUT OF THE WATER!

Each $15,000 will allow us to make one new fuel. We will produce in the order of your preference (See "Vote by claiming perk").  If your fuel does not get made this time you will get your next choice, but don't let that happen. With your thoughtful and generous help we can hit our next milestone and deliver your Perfect Fuel Chocolate. 

All rewards include FREE US shipping!

Huge thanks in advance
~~Nicolas and Miles

 

FAQs:

1. Can I participate if I live outside the US?

Yes, absolutely! Just make sure you add the extra cost of shipping to your contribution. It can be tricky but we are chocolate shipping professionals.

2. Where do you source your ingredients?

Our organic cacao comes from the Dominican Republic and Ecuador. The low GI organic palm sugar comes from South East Asia.  The ginseng is currently sourced from Wisconsin. The products will ALL be vegan, gluten free, soy free and organic.

3. When will the new product ship?

We will be working dilligently over the next 2 months to make the new fuels. It will require long lead times on molds and packaging. We hope to send the new product at the beginning of Dec.

4. Can I get a virtual high five?

Absolutely. Check out our updates and get one right now.
story_txt:
Get more than just chocolate: The Perfect Fuel 
                                 This is not dessert chocolate.
The Perfect Fuel Chocolate story:
It was before the North Country Triathlon in upstate New York that Nicolas was scarfing down raw cacao and real ginseng that he wondered why there wasn’t a chocolate made with anything good for you. Ya know, one with a real benefit and not just a different flavor. Dark chocolate is already the incredible food to beat all Superfoods, and what if you could get the boost you need from something pure, organic, and delicious. I don’t believe you need to settle for little bottles of chemicals for hours of energy or pills to round out your diet. Support Perfect Fuel and this campaign so we can make chocolate good for you.  
Organic Cacao - No refined sugars, naturally gluten free, and packed with something that's actually good for you. 

Where we are today:
From our office in a co-working space called Space with a Soul, we successfully launched a small batch of our Endurance Chocolate with Ginseng. It was inspiring to see that people love healthy chocolate and wanted more! Perfect Fuel Chocolate is becoming a popular snack here in Massachusetts where we are based, and you can help make it even better.
Our community here in Boston and around the globe have been a huge help so far and we invite you to become a part of it.  We are a Youth Trade company, being entrepreneurs under 35 and engaged in the conscious capitalism conversation. Our friends and family have encouraged us on this path and we couldn't have made it this far without their support.  The outside excitement people have shown provide us the energy we need to continue.

We're about to embark on something really amazing, bringing chocolate to a whole new level as a healthy snack. We would love your help on the next leg of our journey: 3 new flavors that will take us there.  Just as we are inspired by triathletes and marathoners we would like to inspire you to be active and eat chocolate while you do it!

Miles and Nicolas - North Country Triathlon - Sharing Chocolate
Where you come in:
We've been getting requests for new varieties of Perfect Fuels and need your help to make healthy chocolate a reality.
The 3 new Fuels we would like to produce are:


Organic Coffee chocolate for its natural caffeine boost

Organic Chia for its high density of omega-3's and fiber

Sea Salt as a delicious recovery chocolate to replenish your electrolytes 

Your supporting funds will be put towards:


Polycarbonate molds for the perfect serving size

Compostable packaging to stay earth friendly and sustainable

Raw ingredients for the best natural fuel we can make. 

Manufacturing Perfect Fuel Chocolate

There are tons of costs that go into creating Perfect Fuel Chocolate and
                 WE NEED YOUR HELP TO BLOW OUR GOAL OUT OF THE WATER!
Each $15,000 will allow us to make one new fuel. We will produce in the order of your preference (See "Vote by claiming perk").  If your fuel does not get made this time you will get your next choice, but don't let that happen. With your thoughtful and generous help we can hit our next milestone and deliver your Perfect Fuel Chocolate. 
All rewards include FREE US shipping!
Huge thanks in advance ~~Nicolas and Miles
 
FAQs:
1. Can I participate if I live outside the US?
Yes, absolutely! Just make sure you add the extra cost of shipping to your contribution. It can be tricky but we are chocolate shipping professionals.
2. Where do you source your ingredients?
Our organic cacao comes from the Dominican Republic and Ecuador. The low GI organic palm sugar comes from South East Asia.  The ginseng is currently sourced from Wisconsin. The products will ALL be vegan, gluten free, soy free and organic.
3. When will the new product ship?
We will be working dilligently over the next 2 months to make the new fuels. It will require long lead times on molds and packaging. We hope to send the new product at the beginning of Dec.
4. Can I get a virtual high five?
Absolutely. Check out our updates and get one right now.

story:
Ready Prevent

This year in the US there will be 1,660,290 people diagnosed with cancer. Of those diagnosed, 580,350 will die.  The most prevalent cancers are lung, breast, prostate, and colon cancer.  228,190 people will be diagnosed with lung cancer this year.  Survival rate varys with staging.  Stage 1A and 1B see a survival rate of 47%.  At stage 2A and 2B the survival rate drops to 30%.  At stage 3A and 3B the average drops to 9%.  Stage 4  survival rate is less than 1%.  Early detection is key in the fight against cancer.  Unfortunately, there has never been a cost efficient or convenient way to test for cancer until now.  Ready Prevent is a medical diagnostics tool that functions much like a blood glucose meter.  From a small blood sample, this tool can give the user an accurate reading of the amount of the body’s natural cancer fighting cell, or lack thereof.  The blood test strips used in the tool are impregnated with a specially engineered antibody targeted towards cancer fighting cells.  Once the blood sample has been applied to the strip, the antibodies attach to all the cancer fighting cells, and are then carried down the strip.  At the end of the strip is a dye that changes in color depending on how many antibodies have attached to cancer fighting cells.  The device, using proven, photometric technology, obtains a reading from the color change which is proportionate to the amount of cancer fighting cells in the blood.

In 2002, the average cost to treat lung cancer was $39,891 a year.  The average cost to treat breast cancer was $20,964 a year.  In 2002, the United States, as a whole, spent $6.7 billion on cancer care.  As you can imagine, the prices since 2002 have risen substantially.  Today, there are thousands of people that cannot afford the rising costs associated with oncology care, and some that can’t even afford the price of normally scheduled checkups.  With Ready Prevent, anyone and everyone will have the ability to check themselves.  Ready Prevent is affordable, and efficient.  The average user will only need to test once a month, while other high risk users, such as smokers, are encouraged to test 2-3 times a month (for research purposes).

 

Can Ready Prevent predict or diagnose cancer?

No.  Ready Prevent cannot predict or diagnose cancer.  What it can do, is let the user know when their body is in a disease state.  This means the user will know when he or she is at the highest risk for tumor development.  Knowing this information is invaluable.  It will let users know when they should take steps to bring their body out of a disease state and seek further medical attention.  Knowing this information could ultimately be the difference between life and death.

What is the impact of Ready Prevent?

The information that Ready Prevent could provide is priceless.  If monitored appropriately and reported, this could give researchers invaluable clues such as: Why these cancer fighting cells become scarce, ways to improve the number of these cells, and how these cells react to certain diets or exercise.

Why we need funding

We are asking for funding in order to further develop our antibody.  Currently we are working with polyclonal antibodies.  Polyclonal antibodies are much more cost efficient in the testing phases.  The drawback to these polyclonal antibodies is, they take much more time and are less efficient to actually harvest.  We are wanting to make a monoclonal antibody so that we can start reproducing our antibody on a mass scale.  This monoclonal antibody will make the testing process much faster, and will cut cost for the consumer.

What you get from funding

By funding this campaign, you will help see that the consumer product is made more efficiently, gets readings more accurately, and costs much less than could have been achieved without funding.

Live Q and A sessions during the campaign!

Please stay posted for updates on our website, we will be holding live question and answer sessions at least 4 times during the course of this campaign. This will help us determine what questions people have and be able to provide you with the information you need to feel confident when contributing to our campaign.

Spread the word!

Please share our campaign and help us reach our goal.  Not only will you be helping this campaign, but you will be contributing to cancer prevention worldwide.

Referal contest!

The top 5 funders with the most referals will all win our Researchers perk package.  The contest starts the day of launch and ends on the last day of the campaign.

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE / ANNOUNCEMENT 

We are overwhelmed by the level of support we have received thus far.
Thank you so much! What seemed to be an impossible goal of $2,000 now
seems real, and we are hoping that with your help, we can continue to
raise support for this extraordinary young woman and her indefatigable
dreams! In the event that we exceed our goal, the money will be spent
towards the next step in Nurjan's life - transferring the help she has
received to others less fortunate than her and in turn sustaining theassistance that has started through your support. 

Upon her recovery, if funds allow, we will be able to procure learning resources and materials that will help Nurjan through her speech therapy after her operation, and at the same time give her a chance to replicate her learning experience with others when she is ready to start her own initiative! Additionally, as she reaches out to others like her, she will need funding to provide the trainings and assistance she dreams of. In the grand scheme, Nurjan hopes to start her own foundation based around "freeing the speech" of children throughout the nation, and with your help these lofty dreams can become a reality! Again, thank you so much for your support and we hope we can continue to move towards helping this young woman realize her dreams of helping a nation cure this medical and social ill.

Brief Summary: 

During my service in the Peace Corps (Kyrgyzstan 2010-2012), I was fortunate enough to meet Nurjan, a talented and driven young woman.  Her dream is to be able to speak normally and to be able to help those who have problems similar to hers.  

The budget for the operation

1 Preparing for Operation.

   1) Dental treatment  - 6 teeth x 2000 som = 12000

   2) examination  (complete blood count CBC, urine analysis, etc.) = 2000 som

2 Transportation to Bishkek

   1) Karakol-Bishkek (two people) 1200som

   2) Bishkek-Karakol = 1200som

3 operation = 12,800 som

4 Post-operative period (child care in the hospital) = 10,000 Som

5 Accommodation + transport (marshrutka) inside the city for accompanying person (attendant)

   1) the cheapest hotel-night in Bishkek -2000som per night 20 days = 40 000 soms

   2) food + travel 8,800 som

6 Speech therapy (instructor)  = 6000som

 Total sum in Kyrgyz Som 94,000

 Total sum in dollar  $ 1924.00

 (the current exchange rate 48.85 som per 1 dollar) 

Thanks for your time. I will make a video in the event that this campaign gets realized and Nurjan will be able to thank you all for your generosity and good will.  Have a good day!

story:
"Champions of Innovation and New Therapies”

We'd like to thank the following Epilepsy Foundation Affiliates for proudly supporting SAMi.  We hope you will click on the links below learn about their good work and support them as well!

Epilepsy Foundation of New Jersey

Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago

Epilepsy Foundation of Long Island

Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Cincinnati and Columbus

Epilepsy Foundation Central & South Texas

Epilepsy Foundation Louisiana

Epilepsy Foundation Colorado

Epilepsy Foundation Kentuckiana

Epilepsy Foundation of Western and Central Pennsylvania

Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Los Angeles

Epilepsy Foundation of Michigan

Epilepsy Foundation of Missouri and Kansas 

Epilepsy Foundation of Idaho

Epilepsy Foundation  Arizona 

Epilepsy Foundation of Metropolitan New York

Epilepsy Foundation of Indiana
“We are happy to support the Epilepsy Foundation’s SAMi Indiegogo campaign.  SAMi not only helps families care for their loved ones through the monitoring/alarming feature, the documentation feature of recordings can also help people with epilepsy and their families communicate with doctors to tailor treatment.  Epilepsy Foundation Louisiana is committed to supporting products like SAMi to help families impacted by seizures.” - Allison DeBattista, Executive Director, Epilepsy Foundation Louisiana
“Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago is proud to support creative innovations that protect people who suffer from epilepsy and provide reassurance and comfort to their families and support providers.” - Kurt W. Florian, Jr., President & CEO, Epilepsy Foundation Greater Chicago
"Research is critically important and we need far more, but it has less meaning if it doesn't eventually benefit those who need it. We want to be a bridge of hope to fast-track research advances to individuals with epilepsy who can benefit. It's about bringing advances to the frontlines where people live -- from lab to life."  - Susan Pietsch-Escueta, Executive Director, Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Los Angeles
“Fear is one of the most crippling emotions for parents of children with epilepsy.  SAMi is a tool that helps provide peace of mind for parents of children with epilepsy.  Enjoying a peaceful nights rest is priceless…” - Sindi J. Rosales, Chief Executive Officer, Epilepsy Foundation Central & South Texas

the people all over the world who have a loved one with a seizure disorder.

What problem are we solving?

There are over 37,000 children diagnosed with RS (Recurring Seizures) every year with an estimated total of 50,000,000 people with RS worldwide. Many caregivers either do not know when seizures occur during the night or they lose a lot of sleep trying to stay awake in case a seizure occurs.

SAMi™ is a sleep activity monitor for caregivers who need to know when unusual movements occur during the night.

What does SAMi do?

  • Sounds an alarm when unusual movement occurs
  • Enables caregivers to sleep with confidence
  • Records and organizes live video and audio

How SAMi is different from other monitors

  • Detects movement and records video in complete darkness
  • Works well with all motion, not just rhythmic movement
  • Sends live audio and video to your Apple iPhone or iPod Touch for remote monitoring
  • Analyzes the live video and sounds an alarm when unusual events occur
  • Saves and organizes the audio and video recordings
  • Enables you to quickly review the recordings, then save and share the important ones

What we have accomplished so far

  • The SAMi app is available as a free download from iTunes.
  • Our website www.samialert.com  supports online sales and has a blog for news and updates.
  • We have marketing materials in English and French and are working on additional translations.
  • We have delivered more than 70 SAMi systems all over the U.S., Canada, and Australia.


With your tax deductible donations, reaching our fundraising goal of $90,000 will allow us to do the following:

  • Get an improved SAMi 3 camera out to families that need it
  • Add more features that are tailored to the RS (Recurring Seizures) community while keeping it simple to install and use
  • Ramp up production and keep costs low
  • Create manuals, installation instructions, and an instructional video
  • Deliver cameras to the Epilepsy Foundation, its affiliates, and other charitable organizations

You can donate by picking a perk at the right.  This will require a credit card. You will receive an email that certifies that you have made this donation as a charitable contribution which you can use when you file your taxes.

If you simply want to donate without a perk (thanks!) choose the big magenta "Contribute Now" button in the upper right.

Here are the instructions for purchasing one or more camera(s) for donation to a charitable foundation. First, please make a donation to purchase one of our camera perks, then simply email us at campaign@samialert.com.  In your email let us know how many camera(s) are for donation and include your suggestion for which charity should receive them.

Shipping to the US is included.  If you are overseas, please add $50.  You can easily do this by selecting the perk, then change the donation amount.  If you forget, click on the "Contribute Now" button in the upper right and contribute another $50. We will connect your contributions prior to shipping and give you credit.

If you would like to donate by check, please send it to:

Epilepsy Foundation
8301 Professional Place
Suite 200
Landover, MD 20785
Attn: Donor Services

Important: Include a note indicating that the donation is for the "Indiegogo SAMi Campaign".

We know that not everyone can donate to our cause, but if you believe in what we are doing please use the "Share" tools at the top of this page and pass our message along.  Your facebook/twitter/google+/email shares can help us make a difference!

Caring for someone with epilepsy can be extremely challenging. If we can help in one significant way, we want to give parents and caregivers a better night of sleep. This leads directly to better care and quality of life for all concerned.

We created SAMi to serve the very personal need to monitor our son while he slept. We had no idea our son was having seizures at night until one time when we were traveling with him.  While sharing a hotel room we discovered that he was having seizures in his sleep. We needed to know more.  We needed to know when he needed us.

We made the first version of our movement detector in 2009. The prototype used an existing network security camera which ran on a dedicated laptop computer. Over the next few years we increased the reliability by calibrating the movement detection algorithm. Charles and I quickly became dependent on the prototype; over time we reduced the false "positives" and eliminated the false "negatives."  Finally, a decent night's sleep!  We knew that we would be alerted when our son needed us.

We realized that this system would also be helpful to others, but dedicating a computer is not practical for most people.  In early 2011 we focused our efforts on building a second generation iOS-based camera which became SAMi. Later that year the Epilepsy Therapy Project announced their first annual Shark Tank Competition. The Epilepsy Therapy Project (now a part of the Epilepsy Foundation) is a non-profit organization whose mission is to improve the lives of people living with recurring seizures. We entered the competition and in February 2012 presented our invention to the judges and an appreciative audience. 

SAMi was awarded first prize

We quickly put the prize money to good use to accelerate the development and production of the SAMi 2 camera. Within six months we produced the first SAMi 2 units for our 10 beta customers.  We now have customers throughout the U.S., Canada and Australia and are looking forward to growing our business and reaching people throughout the world.

SAMi 3 Camera


Imaging:

  • 310,000 Pixel 1/4" CMOS lens.
  • 60°(H) 45°(V) viewing angle.
  • 640x480 resolution.

Built-in microphone:

  • Noise reducing

Night Vision:

  • 30 invisible infrared LEDs with viewing distance of 10m.

Network Connections:

  • Ethernet and Wi-Fi (IEEE802.11b/g/n).

Wi-Fi Security:

  • WEP (64/128 bit), WPA-PSK (AES/TKIP), WPA2-PSK (AES/TKIP).

Power:

  • 100-240V AC.
  • 3m cord with UK/US/EU attachments.

Power Consumption:

  • 3.75W.

Weight:

  • 150g.

Dimensions:

  • 85mm x 85mm x 30mm.

Recording

  • 4GB SD card storage.

What is in the box:

  • Camera
  • Operates in complete darkness
  • Monitor stand
  • Can be placed on a flat surface or attached to the ceiling or wall.
  • 3m power supply
  • With UK/US/EU attachments.
  • 1m network (Ethernet) cable
  • Used to setup the camera.

What is SAMi?
SAMi is an intelligent, configurable, video based nighttime movement detection system. Through the use of specialized software and an infrared camera, a parent or caregiver is alerted on their IOS device to unusual movement in the monitored location. Events are recorded and archived for further use.

I can't afford SAMi.
If your need is immediate and you need assistance purchasing SAMi, visit our resources page at www.samialert.com/resources for a list of organizations we work with, many of which will be receiving cameras from this campaign. 

Is SAMi a medical device?  Can I get insurance to pay for SAMi?

SAMi is not a medical device.  You should check with your insurance provider for assistance in purchasing. 

"SAMi is a nocturnal movement monitor and will detect all types of movement regardless of the movement’s origin.  HiPass Design LLC. does not guarantee the effectiveness of SAMi for any particular application and use of SAMi is solely at your own risk.  SAMi has not been evaluated or approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration or any other government agency for any purpose.  SAMi is not a medical device and is not intended for use in the prevention, diagnosis, mitigation, treatment, or cure of any disease or other conditions.  Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition. "

Can I turn the motion monitoring on and off with an automated schedule?
Yes.

How do I turn the alarm off temporarily?
You may touch the alarm indicator in the upper right corner of the live view screen. It will turn back on automatically if the scheduler is set up.

How long can you run SAMi on your IOS device using battery?
We see run times of roughly 4 hours on a full charge. SAMi can be configured to alert you when the battery is running low.

What is the lock function for?
The lock function dims the screen and secures the SAMi buttons in their current state. This reduces the chance of changing settings in SAMi while handling the IOS device or carrying it in your pocket. While locked the app is still monitoring and will vibrate in addition to playing an alarm sound when triggered

What do you recommend for Wi-Fi?
Wi-Fi performance is important so we recommend using a high quality router. The camera supports IEEE802.11b/g. Most IOS devices now support 5 GHz Wi-Fi and we strongly recommend you use an router that supports this as well. All Apple brand routers work well.

Can I take this with me when we travel?
Yes, but you will normally need to bring a Wi-Fi router as well as the SAMi camera.  Usually it is not possible to connect your camera to a hotel's Wi-Fi. The complete kit includes the Wi-Fi router and is easily relocated.

What is the log?
SAMi records a log that includes information about usage. This does not include video or audio, it simply logs technical information about the motion detection and faults. If you have technical problems we may request that you send us this log.  You can clear the log from the help page.  Note that clearing the log does not delete any of your recordings.

What format are the recordings?
The files are recorded in MP4 format; most modern computers can play them.

How do I save recordings on my computer or email them?
You can get the recordings off the device by following these steps.

  1. Connect the IOS device to iTunes.
  2. Select the device as if you were going to sync it under devices on the left.
  3. Select Apps at the top.
  4. Scroll down to “file sharing” which is below the list of apps.
  5. Select SAMi under file sharing (you may need to scroll through the apps).
  6. You will see the list of recordings on the right. The file names include the date and time the recording was made in the form: Year-Month-Day_Hour-Minute-second_Duration. Recordings that end in “_A” were made when the alarm sounded.  Note that the displayed time next to the name will be different and is less accurate. You can either drag the recording to where you want it to go, or choose “save to…”.

Can I use this to record myself?
Yes. With the alarm muted you can record your sleep for review the next day. These recorded videos may also be useful for purposes of medical consultation. In addition, with the alarm on  SAMi can alert you after unusual activity so you can take action if necessary (for example take medication).

Can I use this during the day?
Yes, however all movement is being analyzed, making the possibility of “false positives” much more likely.

What is the difference between motion threshold and alarm threshold?
The motion threshold determines how much motion is significant. The alarm threshold sets the amount of time for significant motion before the alert is activated. These come with a default setting that can be adjusted.

How should I adjust the motion and alarm thresholds?

The best way to set the thresholds is through a bit of simulation.  You might want to position yourself in the bed with the iPod and watch yourself. Stay very still, then simulate the motion.  You will see the green meter move with the motion. There is a pointer to the side of the meter that indicates the setting of the motion threshold. When you are still, the green meter should be below this. When you simulate the motion, it should be above the pointer. If not, move the motion threshold lower. Best is to do this with the same amount of light as there will be in the room at night. To set the alarm threshold, choose how long the motion needs to continue before the alarm sounds. We found 20 seconds was a good tradeoff between false alarms and missing events.  If you set it shorter, expect more false alarms.  Note that these controls do not affect recordings. Recordings are made whenever there is motion, even slight short motion.

Can I trigger an alarm from just sound?
No, the alarm is based on motion. Audio alarm features are planned.

Does the app work in the background?
No. However, the camera will continue to make recordings and these will transfer to your IOS device once you start SAMi again.

How do I set the clock?
SAMi uses the IOS device clock. Set it through “IOS settings/General/Date & Time”.

What does the motion button do?
When the motion button is pressed the live display highlights motion in red and shows the selected border in green. This is useful for testing the sensitivity of the motion detection and for sizing the border and positioning the camera.

What if I receive a text message or call while I am using the app?
The SAMi application will be suspended while you answer a call. At the end of a call, SAMi will resume. Notifications appear briefly, and will will not interrupt SAMi unless you leave the application to read  or respond to a text message. Note that the camera will continue to make recordings even when the SAMi app is not running. These will transfer to your IOS device once you start SAMi again.

How much time can I record?
Recordings consume 1-4MB of flash memory per minute depending on the amount of motion. On an active night you may see as much as 30 minutes of recordings. With a dedicated 8GB iPod you should be able to keep close to a month’s worth of activity before you would need to start deleting recordings. Note that you can always transfer your recordings to a computer for permanent storage.

How is this different from a baby monitor?
SAMi uses proprietary algorithms to filter out the usual motion and noise that would be reported through a conventional monitor. Fine tuning of the alarm sensitivity will greatly reduce and perhaps eliminate false alerts without compromising the goal of zero missed important movement events. Fewer false alarms equals better sleep!  Sami also has a selective recording capability not found in baby monitors.

Is Wi-Fi required?
The IOS device requires WI-FI but the camera may use either WI-FI or wired Ethernet.

Can I use my own network camera?
No. The SAMi application has been optimized for use with the SAMi camera.

How far away from the camera can my IOS device be?
This is limited only by your WI-FI connection. The typical range using a single Wi-Fi router is around 50 feet (15 meters) indoors. More routers will increase the range. There are also inexpensive Wi-Fi range extenders.  

Do I have to be connected to the internet?
No, unless you want to send us diagnostic information. For this feature you will need to be connected to the internet and you will have to set up an email account on your IOS device.

What is the alarm sound?

Navy Surface Ship General Alarm AN/SIA-114B

We used a Navy Surface ship General Alarm sound, AN/SIA-114B to be precise.  Very effective!

Can I monitor over the internet?
No. The application does not send images or messages across the internet.

Is there an Android version?
No. This may be considered for a future release.

Can I use the app without a network camera?
Yes, you may use the front or back camera on the IOS device but you will not be able to make recordings and the IOS cameras will not work in the dark. This is mostly useful for trying out the app and demonstrations.

Can I make recordings when I am not using the alarm?
Yes, recordings are made even when the alarm is disabled. However, if the alarm is enabled recordings that are made near when the alarm is triggered are marked in red. This helps identify the interesting recordings.

Does the movement have to be rhythmic?
No.

How much movement is required to trigger an alarm or recording?
There is a control for setting the sensitivity of the alarm. It comes with a default setting, but can be adjusted to pick up movements as minor as foot or finger wags.

What are the red lights on the front? Can I turn them off?
The lights are infrared illuminators. This enables a good quality image, even in complete darkness. You cannot turn them off.

Can SAMi detect seizures?
SAMi is a nocturnal movement monitor and not a medical device. It will detect all types of movement regardless of the movement’s origin.

What are the benefits of SAMi?
SAMi offers you the security of having a system in place to dependably alert you only when necessary.  This system is configured to your situation, not a “one size fits all” product.  It provides high quality, accurate recordings that are time/date/duration stamped for purpose of documentation, review/evaluation, and communication with your specialist.

What do I need to make SAMi work?
You will need to have an iPhone or iPod (IOS device).
You will need the free SAMi application from the iTunes store.
You will need the SAMi infrared camera.
You will need WI-FI.

What do I need to run SAMi?
The latest list of supported models is here.

Is there a recommended IOS device?
All the supported devices work well. However, we have found it is really nice if you can dedicate a device to be a monitor. That way you can leave it always running. There is a scheduling feature that automatically turns the monitoring off during the day and back on at night at customized times set by the user. You can find discounted iPods from Apple here.

Cynthia Anderson

President, HiPass Design LLC

Cynthia is the co-founder and President of HiPass Design LLC. She has a background in installing, supporting, and selling business software systems for the manufacturing sector.  Cynthia is also the principal medical advocate for her son James.

Charles Anderson

Charles is the technical lead on project SAMi.  Charles has 35 years of experience in hardware and software engineering and a proven track record in building and leading engineering teams.

Christopher Faranetta

Vice President, New Business Development for HyperV Technologies Corp. Chris is an aerospace and clean energy technology entrepreneur who volunteers his crowdfunding experience to this effort.

Frank Vernon

Frank is a senior software engineer with 20+ years R&D experience in a wide variety of languages and programming paradigms on a diverse set of platforms. Frank is a former Apple employee and has authored several commercially available iOS applications.

Dr. Charles H. Anderson (Ph.D.)

Charlie is a physicist and co-author of “Neural Engineering: Computation, Representation, and Dynamics in Neurobiological Systems.” He recently retired from the Washington University School of Medicine, where he was Research Professor in the Department of Anatomy and Neurobiology.  Charlie is contributing his expertise in image signal processing.

Dr. Edward Maa (MD)

Dr. Maa is Chief of the Comprehensive Epilepsy Program at Denver Health.  He is involved with clinical trials involving the antiepileptic drug development pipeline, but has specific interests in novel therapies including bumetanide and other diuretics, as well as cannabidiol and other phytocompounds used in the treatment of epilepsy. He is currently investigating the use of acupuncture for the treatment of non-epileptic seizures, and has had a long standing interest in the effects of high altitude on patients with epilepsy as well as new onset seizures in travelers to high altitude environments.

Ronya Robinson

Ronya is a senior information designer with 40+ years of experience in designing, writing, and editing technical documentation for software applications.

Matt Anderson

Matt is a student at Northeastern University currently living in Dublin, Ireland working toward his International Business degree in finance.  Matt is our international marketing manager and is contributing his considerable expertise in social media.

James Anderson

James got his tattoo symbolizing courage shortly after having surgery at the Cleveland Clinic for his epilepsy.  We've happily retired his SAMi, he's been seizure free since.  James is currently a student at Colorado State University working towards his degree in watershed science.

Wow.  You actually read all the way to the bottom!  Click here for a special prize!
story_txt:
"Champions of Innovation and New Therapies”We'd like to thank the following Epilepsy Foundation Affiliates for proudly supporting SAMi.  We hope you will click on the links below learn about their good work and support them as well!Epilepsy Foundation of New JerseyEpilepsy Foundation of Greater ChicagoEpilepsy Foundation of Long IslandEpilepsy Foundation of Greater Cincinnati and ColumbusEpilepsy Foundation Central & South TexasEpilepsy Foundation LouisianaEpilepsy Foundation ColoradoEpilepsy Foundation KentuckianaEpilepsy Foundation of Western and Central PennsylvaniaEpilepsy Foundation of Greater Los AngelesEpilepsy Foundation of MichiganEpilepsy Foundation of Missouri and Kansas Epilepsy Foundation of IdahoEpilepsy Foundation  Arizona Epilepsy Foundation of Metropolitan New YorkEpilepsy Foundation of Indiana“We are happy to support the Epilepsy Foundation’s SAMi Indiegogo campaign.  SAMi not only helps families care for their loved ones through the monitoring/alarming feature, the documentation feature of recordings can also help people with epilepsy and their families communicate with doctors to tailor treatment.  Epilepsy Foundation Louisiana is committed to supporting products like SAMi to help families impacted by seizures.” - Allison DeBattista, Executive Director, Epilepsy Foundation Louisiana
“Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago is proud to support creative innovations that protect people who suffer from epilepsy and provide reassurance and comfort to their families and support providers.” - Kurt W. Florian, Jr., President & CEO, Epilepsy Foundation Greater Chicago
"Research is critically important and we need far more, but it has less meaning if it doesn't eventually benefit those who need it. We want to be a bridge of hope to fast-track research advances to individuals with epilepsy who can benefit. It's about bringing advances to the frontlines where people live -- from lab to life."  - Susan Pietsch-Escueta, Executive Director, Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Los Angeles
“Fear is one of the most crippling emotions for parents of children with epilepsy.  SAMi is a tool that helps provide peace of mind for parents of children with epilepsy.  Enjoying a peaceful nights rest is priceless…” - Sindi J. Rosales, Chief Executive Officer, Epilepsy Foundation Central & South Texas
the people all over the world who have a loved one with a seizure disorder.What problem are we solving?There are over 37,000 children diagnosed with RS (Recurring Seizures) every year with an estimated total of 50,000,000 people with RS worldwide. Many caregivers either do not know when seizures occur during the night or they lose a lot of sleep trying to stay awake in case a seizure occurs.SAMi™ is a sleep activity monitor for caregivers who need to know when unusual movements occur during the night.What does SAMi do?

Sounds an alarm when unusual movement occurs


Enables caregivers to sleep with confidence

Records and organizes live video and audio
How SAMi is different from other monitors

Detects movement and records video in complete darkness

Works well with all motion, not just rhythmic movement

Sends live audio and video to your Apple iPhone or iPod Touch for remote monitoring


Analyzes the live video and sounds an alarm when unusual events occur


Saves and organizes the audio and video recordings

Enables you to quickly review the recordings, then save and share the important ones
What we have accomplished so far
The SAMi app is available as a free download from iTunes.

Our website www.samialert.com  supports online sales and has a blog for news and updates.

We have marketing materials in English and French and are working on additional translations.
We have delivered more than 70 SAMi systems all over the U.S., Canada, and Australia.
With your tax deductible donations, reaching our fundraising goal of $90,000 will allow us to do the following:

Get an improved SAMi 3 camera out to families that need it


Add more features that are tailored to the RS (Recurring Seizures) community while keeping it simple to install and use

Ramp up production and keep costs low

Create manuals, installation instructions, and an instructional video

Deliver cameras to the Epilepsy Foundation, its affiliates, and other charitable organizations
You can donate by picking a perk at the right.  This will require a credit card. You will receive an email that certifies that you have made this donation as a charitable contribution which you can use when you file your taxes.If you simply want to donate without a perk (thanks!) choose the big magenta "Contribute Now" button in the upper right.Here are the instructions for purchasing one or more camera(s) for donation to a charitable foundation. First, please make a donation to purchase one of our camera perks, then simply email us at campaign@samialert.com.  In your email let us know how many camera(s) are for donation and include your suggestion for which charity should receive them.Shipping to the US is included.  If you are overseas, please add $50.  You can easily do this by selecting the perk, then change the donation amount.  If you forget, click on the "Contribute Now" button in the upper right and contribute another $50. We will connect your contributions prior to shipping and give you credit.If you would like to donate by check, please send it to:Epilepsy Foundation8301 Professional PlaceSuite 200Landover, MD 20785Attn: Donor ServicesImportant: Include a note indicating that the donation is for the "Indiegogo SAMi Campaign".We know that not everyone can donate to our cause, but if you believe in what we are doing please use the "Share" tools at the top of this page and pass our message along.  Your facebook/twitter/google+/email shares can help us make a difference!Caring for someone with epilepsy can be extremely challenging. If we can help in one significant way, we want to give parents and caregivers a better night of sleep. This leads directly to better care and quality of life for all concerned.We created SAMi to serve the very personal need to monitor our son while he slept. We had no idea our son was having seizures at night until one time when we were traveling with him.  While sharing a hotel room we discovered that he was having seizures in his sleep. We needed to know more.  We needed to know when he needed us.We made the first version of our movement detector in 2009. The prototype used an existing network security camera which ran on a dedicated laptop computer. Over the next few years we increased the reliability by calibrating the movement detection algorithm. Charles and I quickly became dependent on the prototype; over time we reduced the false "positives" and eliminated the false "negatives."  Finally, a decent night's sleep!  We knew that we would be alerted when our son needed us.We realized that this system would also be helpful to others, but dedicating a computer is not practical for most people.  In early 2011 we focused our efforts on building a second generation iOS-based camera which became SAMi. Later that year the Epilepsy Therapy Project announced their first annual Shark Tank Competition. The Epilepsy Therapy Project (now a part of the Epilepsy Foundation) is a non-profit organization whose mission is to improve the lives of people living with recurring seizures. We entered the competition and in February 2012 presented our invention to the judges and an appreciative audience. SAMi was awarded first prizeWe quickly put the prize money to good use to accelerate the development and production of the SAMi 2 camera. Within six months we produced the first SAMi 2 units for our 10 beta customers.  We now have customers throughout the U.S., Canada and Australia and are looking forward to growing our business and reaching people throughout the world.
SAMi 3 CameraImaging: 
310,000 Pixel 1/4" CMOS lens.
60°(H) 45°(V) viewing angle.
640x480 resolution.
Built-in microphone:Noise reducingNight Vision:30 invisible infrared LEDs with viewing distance of 10m.Network Connections:Ethernet and Wi-Fi (IEEE802.11b/g/n).Wi-Fi Security:WEP (64/128 bit), WPA-PSK (AES/TKIP), WPA2-PSK (AES/TKIP).Power:
100-240V AC.
3m cord with UK/US/EU attachments.
Power Consumption:3.75W.Weight:150g.Dimensions:85mm x 85mm x 30mm.Recording4GB SD card storage.What is in the box:
Camera
Operates in complete darkness

Monitor stand

Can be placed on a flat surface or attached to the ceiling or wall.
3m power supply
With UK/US/EU attachments.
1m network (Ethernet) cable
Used to setup the camera.
What is SAMi?SAMi is an intelligent, configurable, video based nighttime movement detection system. Through the use of specialized software and an infrared camera, a parent or caregiver is alerted on their IOS device to unusual movement in the monitored location. Events are recorded and archived for further use.I can't afford SAMi.If your need is immediate and you need assistance purchasing SAMi, visit our resources page at www.samialert.com/resources for a list of organizations we work with, many of which will be receiving cameras from this campaign. Is SAMi a medical device?  Can I get insurance to pay for SAMi?SAMi is not a medical device.  You should check with your insurance provider for assistance in purchasing. "SAMi is a nocturnal movement monitor and will detect all types of movement regardless of the movement’s origin.  HiPass Design LLC. does not guarantee the effectiveness of SAMi for any particular application and use of SAMi is solely at your own risk.  SAMi has not been evaluated or approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration or any other government agency for any purpose.  SAMi is not a medical device and is not intended for use in the prevention, diagnosis, mitigation, treatment, or cure of any disease or other conditions.  Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition. The camera supports IEEE802.11b/g. Most IOS devices now support 5 GHz Wi-Fi and we strongly recommend you use an router that supports this as well. All Apple brand routers work well.Can I take this with me when we travel?Yes, but you will normally need to bring a Wi-Fi router as well as the SAMi camera.  Usually it is not possible to connect your camera to a hotel's Wi-Fi. The complete kit includes the Wi-Fi router and is easily relocated.What is the log?SAMi records a log that includes information about usage. This does not include video or audio, it simply logs technical information about the motion detection and faults. If you have technical problems we may request that you send us this log.  You can clear the log from the help page.  Note that clearing the log does not delete any of your recordings.What format are the recordings?The files are recorded in MP4 format; most modern computers can play them.How do I save recordings on my computer or email them?You can get the recordings off the device by following these steps.
Connect the IOS device to iTunes.
Select the device as if you were going to sync it under devices on the left.
Select Apps at the top.
Scroll down to “file sharing” which is below the list of apps.
Select SAMi under file sharing (you may need to scroll through the apps).
You will see the list of recordings on the right. The file names include the date and time the recording was made in the form: Year-Month-Day_Hour-Minute-second_Duration. Recordings that end in “_A” were made when the alarm sounded.  Note that the displayed time next to the name will be different and is less accurate. You can either drag the recording to where you want it to go, or choose “save to…”.
Can I use this to record myself?Yes. With the alarm muted you can record your sleep for review the next day. These recorded videos may also be useful for purposes of medical consultation. story:
Greetings!  Joe Goins here. 

We have come quite a ways so far, but there is still some distance to go.  Susy has a few more chemo treatments to be free of the colon cancer, but then we will need to address her breast cancer

The goal of this phase of the campaign is to raise $2,222 in 60 days.

All donations are gratefully appreciated and there are Perks.

Donations of $16 or more will receive the Team Susy CD that was released on Dec 1, 2013

The Team Susy CD is a music compact disc produced by Joe Goins and featuring the lovingly donated talents of Bill Pfleging, Rick Bowen, Rob Baker, Alex Dugdale, Mike Daily, Elizabeth Wills, Charis Leos, Eugene Gwozdz, Cindy Maloney, Andrew Palmer Jeffries, Drew Ferraro, Joe Goins & others.

Please join Team Susy with your donation and help us on our journey to return Susy to cancer free wellness

Thank You!!

story:
Miles is a 6-year-old boy living with myelomeningocele, the severest form of Spina Bifida.  While his whole body is affected this campaign is aimed towards helping him develop his communication skills through the use of an assistive device.  At this time, Miles communicates through gestures and sign language.  He is unable to speak and has limited use of his arms and hands.  The DynaVox device, which he has been practicing with for several months, allows him to expand his vocabulary and express himself more fully.  At the press of a button the device for speak for him communicating his wants and needs in a much more clear fashion and for a wider range of people.  He identifies what he wants through pictures and is able to make choices and convey feelings (e.g. I'm hungry, I want to play, etc.).  It really further opens up his world and eliminates a lot of the frustration associated with not being understood.
We have petitioned Miles's insurance company to cover the cost of the device.  He has been denied because he resides in a long term care facility that the insurance company feels should take care of things like this.  They are a wonderful facility who gives him (and the other 100+ children) top notch care, but it is not likely that they can allocate funds for this specific purpose.  So I, his mother, shall do so for him. 
Miles is a wonderful little boy.  I've seen firsthand how cool and rewarding this device is for Miles and for the people around him.  It allows those who don't understand sign language or have an intimate knowledge of Miles to communicate and spend quality time with him.  It also allows Miles to express feelings, emotions and needs that otherwise would be lost to inability. 
We sincerely appreciate any and all donations and prayers. Please contact me with any questions.  Visit http://www.dynavoxtech.com/products/ for more information on DynaVox's devices.  Thank you!
story_txt: Miles is a 6-year-old boy living with myelomeningocele, the severest form of Spina Bifida.  While his whole body is affected this campaign is aimed towards helping him develop his communication skills through the use of an assistive device.  At this time, Miles communicates through gestures and sign language.  He is unable to speak and has limited use of his arms and hands.  The DynaVox device, which he has been practicing with for several months, allows him to expand his vocabulary and express himself more fully.  At the press of a button the device for speak for him communicating his wants and needs in a much more clear fashion and for a wider range of people.  He identifies what he wants through pictures and is able to make choices and convey feelings (e.g. I'm hungry, I want to play, etc.).  It really further opens up his world and eliminates a lot of the frustration associated with not being understood.We have petitioned Miles's insurance company to cover the cost of the device.  He has been denied because he resides in a long term care facility that the insurance company feels should take care of things like this.  They are a wonderful facility who gives him (and the other 100+ children) top notch care, but it is not likely that they can allocate funds for this specific purpose.  So I, his mother, shall do so for him.  Miles is a wonderful little boy.  I've seen firsthand how cool and rewarding this device is for Miles and for the people around him.  It allows those who don't understand sign language or have an intimate knowledge of Miles to communicate and spend quality time with him.  It also allows Miles to express feelings, emotions and needs that otherwise would be lost to inability.  We sincerely appreciate any and all donations and prayers. Please contact me with any questions.  Visit http://www.dynavoxtech.com/products/ for more information on DynaVox's devices.  Thank you!

story:
Summary
After 4 years of study, preparation, discernment, and formation, I’m honored and delighted to be getting ordained into the Unitarian Universalist Ministry at 4:00 pm on February 28th, 2015 at All Souls Church, Unitarian in Washington, DC! This fund was created to help cover the costs of the ordination.


Why Ministry?

I have felt called to Unitarian Universalist ministry since I was 17 years old. In no other career could I imagine being able to use my heart, soul, body, and mind so fully. In ministry, I am privileged to walk alongside people through the most joyful and painful moments of life – weddings and funerals, baby dedications and frightening illnesses. As a minister I bear witness to the soul-wrestlings of my people and work with them to make a difference in our community and create justice in the larger world around us. As a minister, I serve people as well as lead them, hold myself accountable to them and work with them to build beloved community. This work uses every ounce of my gifts in the world, and pushes me to grow in difficult and transformative ways.

As a Unitarian Universalist minister, I live the most meaningful life I can imagine – a life dedicated to helping others find meaning in their lives; a life dedicated to transforming the world towards greater justice, love, and wholeness.

Becoming ordained will be one of the most significant moments of my life.

What is an Ordination?

An ordination is an important rite of passage of religious leadership in many faith traditions. In Unitarian Universalism (UUism), the ministers are called out from among the people into leadership. We are ordained not by a bishop, not by mystical experience of the Holy, but by the people we serve - people that see us as ministers and call us into our vocation. After serving as their ministerial intern in 2012-2013, and completing all the steps of ministerial preparation set up by the larger UU faith tradition, All Souls Church, Unitarian, voted in December, 2014 to ordain me. Though I no longer serve them as one of their ministers, I could not be more pleased to be called into service of my faith, of humanity, and of the world than by these beloved people who played such an important role in my formation.

Why this funding campaign?

All Souls has generously set aside money to cover the some of the costs of the ordination, and we are working on additional fundraising activities in order to ensure that we can reimburse the travel costs of the clergy who will lead the ordination ceremony, pay for childcare and music, and offer hospitality to those who attend the ordination ceremony.

This fund has been created to supplement the congregation’s fundraising efforts, and to provide an opportunity for those who are not part of All Souls Church in DC to support my ordination if they feel so moved. 

About Abbey:

Born and raised in the Boston area, I am a life-long Unitarian Universalist. My previous life included climate change and renewable energy policy work and grants management for the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, and a Masters of Business Administration in nonprofit management. I served as a national UU leader in my youth, chairing my regional UU youth movement and representing my region on the national UU youth council. During college, I ran a successful effort to create a youth trustee position on the national Unitarian Universalist Association (UUA) board, took a year off to work on youth programming at the UUA headquarters, then was appointed as the youngest person ever to serve on the national UU ministerial credentialing body (the Ministerial Fellowship Committee), ultimately serving in that role for 8 years. I count racial justice work as some of the most important work I have been involved with in my life (work that has taken many incarnations within and beyond Unitarian Universalism). 

In my twenties, my family and I companioned my father through his struggle with brain cancer and his eventual death. Being present to him during that time remains one of the most powerful experiences of my life. I have been married and divorced, and have moved 9 times in the past 6 years. All of the joys and griefs of my life have been part of my path to the ministry - deepening and opening me; bringing me closer to the rawness and richness of the human experience. These days, I work as Interim Advancement Director for Starr King School for the Ministry, the seminary I am honored to have graduated from last May. It is a joy to connect with donors and others interested in supporting Starr King, and I look forward to returning to parish ministry sometime in the next few years once Starr King is ready to find the long-term advancement staff who will best carry them into their next chapter. I live in Oakland, CA with my 2 cats.

About the ordination:

The ordination will take place at 4pm on February 28th, 2015 at All Souls Church, Unitarian in Washington DC. Clergy, seminarians, and religious educators are invited to gather at 3:30pm to robe and process in the ceremony. A reception for all will follow. I’m honored to have many of my close colleagues and mentors leading the service including the preacher Rev. Jay Leach, senior minister at the Unitarian Universalist Church of Charlotte, NC; Rev. Dr. Rob Hardies, senior minister of All Souls DC; Rev. Rosemary Bray McNatt, president of Starr King School for the Ministery; and Rev. Dr. Rebecca Parker, president and professor emeritus of Starr King. Together, we will experience transcendent music from the All Souls choirs and celebrate this meaningful beginning. 

All are welcome, and I hope to see you there!

* Thank you to Jessie Gladdek for the main picture above!

story:
SHE DID IT!!!  4:25:57!!!

Exonerating the Innocent


Dennis Maher was identified as the assailant in 3 sexual assaults that occurred in Lowell and Ayer, Massachusetts, and was convicted in 1984.  In 2003, DNA testing definitively excluded him as the assailant.  Dennis had spent 19 years in prison because of eyewitness identification procedures, since discredited, that biased witnesses towards identifying him as the perpetrator.

James "Jimmy" Hebshie was convicted of arson and related crimes in 2006.  Fire destroyed the building which housed his variety store in Taunton, Massachusetts  in 2003.  In 2010, after Jimmy had spent 4 years in federal prison, his conviction was overturned because the "science" underlying his conviction was proven to be deeply flawed.

According to conservative estimates, 2.5% of all people who are convicted or plead guilty are factually innocent. There have been 41 exonerations in Massachusetts alone.

In less than a month, Lisa Kavanaugh will be running her first marathon, as she takes on the 2014 New York City Marathon. She is taking on this challenge to raise awareness of wrongful convictions and to raise the funds necessary to pay for the initial investigative, scientific and technical expertise needed to identify and exonerate people who were wrongfully convicted.

Lisa has spent her career representing people who could not afford to pay for their own defense, and she has seen first hand the many ways that our justice system can fail these clients. She now directs the Innocence Program at the Committee for Public Counsel Services, where she works closely with Denise McWilliams, who is the Executive Director of the New England Innocence Project. Denise and Lisa are currently working to exonerate over 40 people who have been wrongfully convicted of crimes in the Massachusetts and the New England area.

The Process

Innocence claims have to be thoroughly reviewed before a case can be brought into court. This review often requires help from investigators and experts in many scientific and technical disciplines. For example, in the 1980s and 1990s, many fires were "determined" to be arson because of widely held myths and misunderstandings about how fire moves within a building and the burn patterns it leaves behind. Cameron Todd Willingham may be the best known example of this: in 2004, the state of Texas executed Mr. Willingham for allegedly setting the 1991 fire in which his 3 daughters were killed. Tragically, it was only after his execution that improvements in the scientific field established that the fire was of accidental origin. Denise and Lisa are currently investigating several Massachusetts arson convictions that relied upon the same flawed science that brought about Willingham's execution.

There is little funding available for the preliminary work needed work to bring these cases into court. This is particularly true of cases that do not involve DNA evidence. Running for Innocence offers a way to change that, by allowing people to directly donate funds toward the cost of bringing innocence claims to light.

The Impact

Simply put, we believe it is wrong that innocent people are in prison for crimes they did not commit.  It disrupts their lives, removes them from their families and keeps them from contributing to their communities. Where a crime has been committed, wrongful convictions also allow the actual perpetrators to remain free and, in some cases, they have gone on to commit additional crimes.

Frequently, innocence cases require $5,000.00 to $7,000.00 in expert and investigator costs. As a non-profit organization, the New England Innocence Project is responsible for raising the funds to pay for this important leg work. Our progress can be stalled because we lack the money to hire much needed experts and investigators. Every delay means that an innocent person spends additional time in prison for a crime he or she did not commit.

This is why the New England Innocence Project needs your help. Your contributions will pay for everything from expert case review to hours of private investigation to DNA testing. You will be directly responsible for giving the 40 innocent men and women whose wrongful convictions we are working to overturn a fighting chance to achieve justice and freedom.

The Risks and Challenges

These cases are tough.  The legal system is not designed to respond to cases of actual innocence. Courts are slow to accept the compelling evidence that the forensic and scientific techniques used to convict people are flawed, that eyewitnesses make mistakes, that informants lie, that people falsely confess. And these cases are expensive. They require painstaking work by people in many disciplines in order to be successful.

Fortunately, the New England Innocence Project and the attorneys, experts and investigators we work with have the litigation and social justice experience needed to help innocent clients achieve freedom and justice. Together we can work to ensure that there is no one in a Massachusetts prison for a crime they did not commit.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Help us get the word out-notify your networks about this campaign, and about our work!

2. Join the Running for Innocence Team! Email rfi@newenglandinnocence.org for further information.

Thank you!!

story:
Dear Ones,

We are going on a special journey that we are inviting you to take with us. We have been invited to be of service to a Great Soul, Phakyab Rinpoche, a high ranking Tibetan Lama who was inprisoned and tortured by the Chinese. He ultimately escaped with life threatening injuries and healed these injuries using the teachings of the Medicine Buddha. Rinpoche has written a book that was released in France last month about his experiences and healing and has been widely received. His book will be translated and released in the US in 2015. Rinpoche has a significant global following of students and has been gifted a property in Normandy, France, that is a 50 minute train ride from Paris. With Rinpoche, we will be expanding the existing property into an international  retreat center for the Medicine Buddha teachings.

Our role is to be of service to Rinpoche by expanding, developing and designing this sacred place, Menla Thodol Ling, which is steeped in his presence and committed purpose. We will be working with an architect from San Francisco, Barbara Brown, who is a student of Phakyab Rinpoche and who designed the Northern California Tibetan Center. .Even more than the giving of our talents and international experience for this amazing project, we are seeking a deeper awakening of our own hearts as we are being guided to the Rinpoche's teachings for our healing.

This is truly a Journey of a Lifetime and we are asking you join us by directing your energy to the success of this endeavor. The idea of bringing you along came from a number of friends who saw this as an opportunity for our entire "Tribal Family." We are asking that you contribute financially as your affirmation of our journey as well as the journey of Menla Thodol Ling, as it is manifested in to (into) a global center for those seeking greater enlightenment at these magnificent and yet challenging times.  We are seeking $5,000 for two coach airline tickets and minimal travel expenses and any amount above that will go the Menla's development, so we are trusting that our family and friends will be guided to an appropriate amount for such a donation. For those contributing, we will issue a monthly blog so you can follow both processes -- the awakening of Menla, the awakening of the Zimmers. Our goal is to travel to France in mid-January. We both feel that this center is truly a gift to the world and we feel so humbled to use all our years of design and development experience in manifesting this great vision.

Heartfelt gratitude and love,

Dolores and Bob

Pertinent Information:

http://dhenpa.org/AboutUs.html

http://www/huffingtonpost.com/maureen-seaberg/the-rise-of-a-rinpoch_b_5702301.html

www.zimmerassociatesinternational.com

See Lilou Mace's Interview with Robert Zimmer on You Tube

story:
Hey guys,

  So I went to my surgeon Dr. Weinzweig and he gave me an amazing quote for my new surgeries. I have almost 80% of the money, but any help from you guys would be appreciated.

You know I'll give gifts back! The surgery is to fix my nipples, fix a scar under my left boob, and go slightly bigger and over the muscle.

I have literally hated my boobs for so long and get so upset sometimes and I really want to be able to do this surgery in November and not wait till after AVN. So please HELP!!

xoxoxo,

Kelly

story:
ABOUT ME

My name is Dr. Vrej Sarkis. I’m an Armenian doctor from Syria. I moved to Armenia a couple of years ago to flee the war in Syria, and now I’m making a new life for my family and myself. I specialize in cardiac and neonatal ultrasound and work in a number of hospitals in Armenia. I’m one of few health professionals in Armenia who provide cardiac ultrasound and mobile clinic care to Armenia’s citizens.

THREE-FOLD MISSION

I seek to reduce the present and future burden of disease in Armenia, a low middle-income country, and to promote improvements in health care delivery by:

1. Providing preventative health care services to elderly and newborn babies in Armenia through an innovative approach using ultrasound technology.

2. Making home visits to patients who cannot access or afford services at medical centers in Armenia.

3. Using the latest communications technologies to bring specialized medical knowledge to Armenia to reduce morbidity and mortality.

DONATIONS

There are many elderly patients suffering from chronic diseases, such as hypertension and diabetes, who don’t have access to hospitals. Having a vehicle to transport my medical equipment would allow me to provide diagnostic services to these patients at their homes.

*All proceeds go toward the purchase of a mobile medical vehicle to make this dream a reality.*

Your donation can help save many lives. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello everyone!

Your favorite quidditch team is taking their next big step: World Cup VII! The Quidditch World Cup is the largest tournament of the year and hosts a number of IQA official teams in some of the most intense games of the year. Teams have competed in regional tournaments around the world to qualify, and we made it! The Apparators will be heading to Myrtle Beach on April 4, and we need your help and support to get there!

By donating to this Indiegogo account, your money will be used to help the Apparators cover the cost of transportation, lodging, and other expenses. Your donations, small and large, will help the Apparators travel to Myrtle Beach and compete against teams from around the world. Also, when you donate, you can choose from some great perks!


Thank you so much for supporting the Apparators!

Commissioners Courtney Colwell and Alex Gates
story_txt: Hello everyone!Your favorite quidditch team is taking their next big step: World Cup VII! The Quidditch World Cup is the largest tournament of the year and hosts a number of IQA official teams in some of the most intense games of the year. Teams have competed in regional tournaments around the world to qualify, and we made it! The Apparators will be heading to Myrtle Beach on April 4, and we need your help and support to get there!By donating to this Indiegogo account, your money will be used to help the Apparators cover the cost of transportation, lodging, and other expenses. Your donations, small and large, will help the Apparators travel to Myrtle Beach and compete against teams from around the world. Also, when you donate, you can choose from some great perks!Thank you so much for supporting the Apparators!Commissioners Courtney Colwell and Alex Gates

story:
2 and a half year old Teresita Banyos needs surgery to remove a tumor from her eye.

Teresita's mother is s single mother of two daughters. She cannot afford the $1,500US (11,779 Guatemalan quetzals) it will cost to have the tumor removed. They have relocated to Guatemala because the hospitals and doctors there are more equipped to handle her condition and the surgery there is more affordable. 

I met little Teresita through my work raising tuition money to help poor Belizean children attend school (www.gringogrands.info). She is smart, happy, and a delightful child though she experiences great pain and has difficulty sleeping.  Once she has the surgery, her prognosis is good, but without it, the tumor will continue to grow. 

Donation's will go directly into a fund to pay the doctors and hospital costs for Teresita's surgery. All contributors will receive reports and photos describing Teresita's progress after surgery and the knowledge that they have helped save the life of a deserving little girl. Please help Teresita thrive and tell others about Teresita via your email lists, social media contacts and Indiegogo share tools.  Blessed be.

story:
Come ride with us!

Join us as we cycle through the heartland of New Zealand in the sixth annual BDO Wellington to Auckland Cycle Challenge, Sunday 9 to Saturday 15 February 2014.

This Year Invacare will ride to raise money for the Attitude Trust New Zealand.

It's an endeavour led by people with lived experience of disability and embraces the voice of the broader disability community. The team at AttitudeLive seek to empower people through the telling of strong human stories, and by linking our users to key information.  AttitudeLive  connects you to the global community.

2014 Official Event Charity

The Multiple Sclerosis Society of New Zealand

The Multiple Sclerosis Society of New Zealand (Inc) is a non-profit organisation formed to provide on-going support,  education and advocacy for people with MS and their support networks.   It also aims to educate the general public, employers and health  professionals about MS and actively funds key research into the  condition.

The Society was formed in 1967  and today there are 18 Regional Societies from Northland to Southland  supported through advice, education and materials by the National  Office.

 

Help us raise much needed funds to support a worthy cause as we take the simple pleasure of riding a bike, multiple it by seven days, 110km per day, 13 stages, big hills, good times and personal accomplishments, and you have a recipe for an awesome experience.

Departing from the main street in Lower Hutt and finishing in Pukekohe, each day is divided into one or two stages covering anywhere from 38km – 122kms.

Come discover the North Island of New Zealand from the seat of a bike.

story:
As the NCAA and the Big Five conferences prepare for an inevitable round of realignment, the University of Kansas must position itself. The last major step for Kansas is major renovations to Memorial Stadium. 


The initial goal is $200 500 and this fundraiser will keep renewing after each 60 day deadline.  Donations will be given to the KUAC/WEF and specifically earmarked for stadium improvements.  Any dollar amount is accepted.  There are currently no perks available. 

Oklahoma has announced a $400 million stadium improvements,  TCU and Baylor will soon unveiling new stadiums, and Iowa State and instate rival ksu have also announced imrovements.

Its absolutely vital that Kansas makes much needed renovations. Upper concourse, restrooms, wifi, removing track and lowering field are just some of the immediate needs at Memorial Stadium.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign, earmark donations for Memorial Stadium, or donate to WEF and KUAC

story:
FitMonkey is a free mobile app designed to help users find and book fitness professionals and workout classes in their local area. With FitMonkey users can easily find and book one-on-one personal training sessions, small group workouts, and fitness classes that work with their schedule.

FitMonkey is creating a new way for people to do sports, find gyms, personal trainers and classes. We want to provide people with the transparency and flexibility to choose what’s best for them at the right moment, from daily gym passes to yoga classes, to a full fledged personal trainer, all with no contracts and the simplicity of a booking on your mobile.

All funds received will be used to develop the app and market it. A decent mobile application costs at least 8000GBP. Any and all donations welcome. 

Even if you can't donate, it would be fantastic if you could share this on your social networks and help spread the word.
