No repairs have been done on the house since 2003 when her husband died, except for the new roof that was never finished and improperly installed (which needs repair also)--the roofer put the correct color shingles on the back 3/4th of the house and a bright green on the front---he never finished the install when the mistake was mentioned and has never answered calls since... She is still active in the organizations, and is always doing something for others--never expecting anything in return. She bakes bread every week for the ill, shut-ins, bereaved---even supplies Communion Bread for our church. She has been recognized by the Business and Professional Women's local club as "Woman of the Year" and received the 2009 Augusta Industrial Development Corp "Outstanding Service Award" presented by Dr. Steve Collier with the Governor of Arkansas present. She still does daily watering and weeding, usually alone, at the two parks in downtown Augusta, AR, as chair of the parks committee. However, as deserving and grateful for the recognition, none of this has brought her any funds, and as tirelessly giving and faithful to the organizations to which she belongs, and to the church and community, we would be so pleased to see her receive some help to make her house safe and more like a home. She is embarrassed to invite friends / even family over (even for coffee) because of the risk anyone takes just crossing the porch (that stands 5 feet off the ground supported by the orginal brick columns), and that really hurts us because she was always an "open house", warm and generous hostess...
The entire house is in need of repair, but the front and back porches are the most pressing... I thought it best to ask for help funding the repairs the home is in most urgently needed... Various family members have fallen through the deteriorating front porch floor boards, but luckily my 79 year old Mother has not!!! The goal amount is the lowest of three estimates that Gayne has gotten for repairs...
We know her dream was to always turn her home into a Bed and Breakfast Heritage Inn just a block away from the White River (which would be a perfect place for anyone that wishes to visit this hunting and fishing paradise) ...We would love to eventually make this dream a reality, and with your (and the rest of the world's) help---I believe it will be a reality sooner than my Mom's dreams!!!



Safety for visitors of Mom

The goal of $16,000 is just to cover the restoration of the front and back porches (the front porch is in the video and the back porch has completely fallen off of the house---making the two back doors unuseable)...
Any additional funds over the $16,000 goal will go toward hiring another roofer to finish and repair the first roofers shoddy work, repair to the plaster of the ceilings and walls throughtout the house and repainting them, hanging sheetrock upstairs to finish the four bedrooms, and upgrade the heating and air conditioning system.
If the goal of $16,000 is not reached the funds that are collected will be used to repair the porches to the best of the contractors abilities...


The History of the House
According to Arkansas Historical Preservation Group there are similar homes thoughout the state, but none that have the ornate architectural features that Mom's house has...

The house was built in 1904 by the Eldridge family; they sold it to the Cain family in 1908, and the Cain's lived there until Mom and Dad bought the house in 1974... History tells us that the Eldridge family had the home built, William R. Cain was a County, Municipal, and District Judge and also Justice of the Peace, and Mom has owned several small businesses in town since her and Dad's move from Memphis, TN in 1974 (to be closer to her elderly Mother, Ollie Preller, now deceased) 
It is important to the the town's history to restore this house because many of the homes of this age have either been condemned and torn down or have burned.
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand and associate with the fact that not everyone can help monetarily, but we urge you to help us "get the word out" for the preservation on this once magnificent landmark historical home...

Please share the two following youtube video links with anyone you think might help my Mom...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BfQB0SodMWs
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vEMpdOW-SQ
Thank you so much for listening (reading) and getting to know my Mother, Gayne Preller Schmidt. We welcome any assistance...God Bless

story:
Hi, my name is Jordan Gibbins. My teammate (Marjo Whalen) and I are training for the Nation’s Triathlon in Washington D.C on September 9, 2012, in honour of all the brave individuals who have fought against cancer.

    As well as training with TEAM IN TRAINING in honour of these individuals, we are fundraising to support the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society of Canada for blood cancer research, improving the quality of lives of patients and their families and to help find a cure for this ruthless disease! We both have been closely affected by cancer, and during our fundraising efforts we have realized that everyone has a story - their stories are truly inspirational! 

    So we have decided to use our physical abilities, when others may not be as fortunate, to raise money and awareness for blood cancer research! Please join us, and help put an end to blood cancers.

Feel free to contact us should you have any questions: 2tntgals@gmail.com

I sincerely thank you for your support!

Jordan Gibbins and on behalf of my teammate, Marjo Whalen.

story:
FORUTNATELY, OUR OBJECTIE HAS CHANGED AND IS OF MORE LESS MONEY SINCE THE MINISTER OF CULTURE OF THE DOMINICAN REPUBLIC HAS ACCEPTED TO FUND JEAN GIRIGORI'S PROTHESIS !!! THERE IS ONLY IS NEED FOR HER SURGERY TO ADAPT HER EXISTING LEG TO THE PROTHESIS. THANK YOU SUPPORTERS AND WE WILL KEEP YOU POSTED !!! This inspiring project and of high importance is in favour of the painter Jean Girigori who has for objective to unite the efforts so that she can walk again. It is a story of faith and perseverance, a humanitarian cause. Of a Dominican mother and a father from Curazao, a sailor, Jean was born 62 years ago in a boat on waters of the Caribbean sea. She studied art in Haiti and in New York and introduced to  her first exhibitions in Curazao. Her way to see the world in its works, once having traveled Europe, the United States and Latin America, deserved her the nickname of Painter of the magic Arc of the Caribbean. Seven years ago, she was is subjected to an operation of a slipped disc in Caracas, Venezuela. Seven days after the intervention, one of her leg became infected with a bacteria and had to be cut. Jean also lost a finger of her right hand: " (...) The hand which I used to play my guitar and sing life! ". According to the famous art critic, Abil Peralta Aguero, Jean Girigori is one of the greatest women painters of the Caribean, (...) with paintings in which the vitality of her imagination of ancestral roots overflows, since which it touches fundamental aspects of the social reality of our time and translates them into its paintings in category of symbols of a strong testimonial and collective component. By making sure that its atavistic thought is there, living and in full capacity of observation of the whole, as the drama, the love, the passion or the despair in the heart of our vibrating West Indian culture. " Pioneer of the art in the Caribbean, she deserved the recognition of several institutions, amongst others, the College of PLASTIC ARTS and the MUSEUM OF MODERN ART for the vitality and aesthetic authentic values of her pictorial work, by her transcendent contributions in favour of the broadcasting of the identical artistic and cultural expressions of the peoples of the Caribbean during the last four decades in THIRD INTERNATIONAL FAIR OF THE CARIBBEAN.

 Since May, 2012, family, friends and some artists joined to support the movement of the artist in this rescue of her health and cultural legacy so she can also continue with her artistic and social contribution. They started some initiatives for which they wish your implication.

story:
What Is The History Of And How Big Is The Effort To Eradicate Polio From The World?

The goal of the Global Polio Eradication Initiative is to ensure that no child will ever again know the crippling effects of polio. The Global Polio Eradication Initiative is the largest public health initiative the world has ever known.

Globally, polio cases have fallen from 350,000 in1980s to 205 cases in 2011. Only four countries still have new polio cases: Afghanistan, India, Nigeria, and Pakistan.

As long as polio threatens even one child anywhere in the world, children everywhere remain at risk. The stakes are that high. 

There are, however, 12 million polio survivors in the world today and those in the third world lead a very tragic life.  It is these survivors to whom Wheels of Hope is dedicated.
Welcome to Wheels of Hope

The purpose of Wheels of Hope is to provide funds to a workshop in Northern Nigeria that builds wheelchairs specifically designed for polio survivors and constructed for the country they need to navigate.  

Given his first wheelchair at the age of 19, Ayuba Gufwan, the builder of our wheelchairs, began an education leading to a university degree. He returned home with a vision to start a workshop to help the region's many polio survivors. It is there he builds hand crank wheelchairs; providing them free to polio survivors.









What is Wheels of Hope?



Wheels of Hope is a 501(c)3 international project of the Rotary Club of Traverse City, Michigan, partnering with four Rotary Clubs located in Jos, Nigeria designed to providing a sustaining revenue stream to to build wheelchairs and donate them way to polio survivors; enabling them to attend school, get good jobs, marry and enjoy fulfilling and productive lives. 

While there is no shortage of interested donors worldwide from the constituencies available to us, success requires effective marketing

It is our goal, with good marketing, to provide $75,000 each year -  enough to build and distribute 600 wheelchairs.



Meet one of our Wheels of Hope Friends  


Uma is a 15-year-old in Nigeria; pretty as a picture and not a lot different emotionally from any of our daughters or granddaughters. 

Of course for Uma there are some differences.  Up to a year ago she had never attended school and as a polio survivor her crippled legs prevent doing any work and helping with the family income. Uma spends most of her day begging in the street with other polio survivors. Her smile, however, remains undiminished, just like her aspirations. She hopes to one day attend school, become a doctor and have a family.









On her way to fulfilling dreams, Uma now has a wheelchair, presented about a year ago. Her smile is infectious, reflective of her new found mobility and lending promise to some unfulfilled life achievements. 

She is now attending school 13 miles from her family' s hut, wheeling herself to and from the bus stop every day.

Her new mobility has given Uma hope while inciting family encouragement and support for her schooling. Her promising future holds the potential for helping financially support her family. 





What Does Wheels Of Hope Need The Money For?

The Rotary Club of Traverse City donated $6500 in startup funds.  these funds are now expended for legal and other start-up costs. Our prime function is now to market to other Rotary Clubs, Churches and individuals who might want to support our project. 

Funds from the Indiegogo campaign will be used to create a video, design and print flyers to distribute, secure additional website resources and fund a trip to Jos, Nigeria in the spring of 2012 to work directly with the Nigerian Team and to bring home additional marketing-related stories, visuals and video documentaries.





How Does Wheels of Hope Expect to Raise Funds to build Wheelchairs?

Wheelchairs, can be purchased through our website at www.wheelsofhope.net
 


They make an ideal gift, program honorarium, special recognition or congratulations. $125 purchases one wheelchair. We furnish all donors of wheelchairs with customized, personalized certificates of recognition and a polio survivor picture.   













I

story:
STREAMING FITNESS CLASSES 


No more wondering if you are doing the right exercises, the right way and at the right intensity. With a focus on both functional training and education our classes will give you the tools to succeed.  Evolve will stream high quality fitness videos to your smart phone, tablet, computer or television when it's convenient for you.  We will regularly produce a myriad of fitness classes including Yoga, Body Weight, HIIT, Pilates, Dance, Kettle bell, Dumbbell, Medicine Ball and even Treadmill classes so that you can train how you want when you want.  

FUEL YOUR FITNESS

Nutritional Coaching, Tracking, Reporting and Education will guide you to a higher quality of life.  Registered Dietitians will teach you healthy habits, meal preparation, and  nutritious recipes. We dispel the numerous myths/hype of quick fixes that exist in the world.  Learn what to eat, when to eat, how to prepare it, how to adapt and how to make it a part of your life.

STAY ON TRACK

Part of reaching your goals, progressing and evolving is staying on track, measuring progress and being held accountable.  With Evolve we help you select effective habits, hold you accountable to them and show your progress along the way.  This is your life, your health, your fitness and your happiness and with Evolve we will help you make the most of every single day.

TRUST US


Doctors, Physicians, Registered Dietitians, Licensed Therapists & Several Certified Fitness Professionals are on our board.  Evolve is grounded in science and built around some of the greatest professionals in the world.  The information you receive will be of the highest quality, supported by fact, not opinion, and will give you the piece of mind you deserve when looking for answers for your health.  


THE PROBLEM:

Our goal at Evolve is to give you the tools and help you overcome obstacles. Through our experience we've learned the main health and fitness stumbling blocks have been:

  1. Not knowing what to do or how to do it.
  2. No time to exercise.
  3. Not motivated.
  4. Bored.
  5. Intimidated by fitness myths & conflicting information.
  6. Don't like the gym.

THE SOLUTION:

Evolve came up with a solution to keep you going, educate you, excite you and most importantly help you change your life.

  • Make Fitness & Exercise Convenient
  • Make It Engaging 
  • Keep It Science Based and "Fad Proof"
  • Give People Motivation
  • Keep People Accountable
  • Make It Customizable
  • Make It Fun & Social
  • Keep It at Home, Work, Travel, Wherever You Go. 

YOUR CLASSES

The classes that you watch will be instructive, visually engaging and available any time you want them.  Certified and licensed fitness professionals guide you through Yoga, Pilates, Strength, Core, Bodyweight, Circuit, Cardio and many other classes in order to ensure you perform the movements efficiently and effectively.  Each video will provide several camera angles, visual animation guides and audio cues to coach you through the entire session.  The videos we produce are unlike any other fitness dvd because we want to educate you as you exercise so you continue to progress with each class.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to launch the website, mobile apps and produce these amazing fitness classes:

  • The bulk of the funds raised will be directed to video class production.  Our instructors, editors, producers, equipment and filming process gets to be quite costly and we are shooting each class with cinema quality cameras so that you see every move in HD and can examine every detail.  Evolve will give you the most engaging and instructive fitness videos you have ever experienced.
  • The other area where we need funds is to complete the development of the final version of the website, mobile app and television app to ensure that fitness & health are easy to access, can go anywhere you can and to ensure that we can help as many people as possible improve their lives.



  • If we don't reach our entire goal we will make a decision based on the funding received thus far what features will be included in the initial launch that will be worth it to our backers or if we can't raise enough to launch a product that will help change lives we will refund all pledges.

The Impact

Launching Evolve online has been a dream of mine for the past 4 years and it is finally ready to be released to the public that so desperately needs it.  In the United States alone over 66% of our population is over weight or obese and what drives me the most is thinking of all the parents, children, aunts, uncles, friends and relatives who's lives are cut short due to a lack of time, drive and/or knowledge.  Your pledge will help us change that.  Evolve will give each and every user the tools to own their fitness, control their health and live a better life.  

I grew up in a very active family with parents who love me, supported me as I played soccer and instilled in me the belief that I could do or be anything I wanted.  As I grew into an adult I watched as both of my parents suffered with heart disease, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, diabetes and other ailments associated with inactivity all while working 40-60 hour work weeks to support their family.  

I live in another state with my wife but knew there had to be a way to help them without being physically in front of them.  So we started with the basics, learned about proper foods to eat, gave them detailed-video-guided workouts they could do no matter how much time they had and kept them on track by checking in each day.  Medications were lowered, doctors were amazed and lives were changed as both of my parents became healthier and stronger simply by being given the information, the motivation and the direction.  

There is no greater joy than to see the lives of those you love changed for ever, to see them smile when they realize the power within themselves to control their health and to see them year after year getting stronger, happier and fitter.  I want to share that with you, with your family and with those you love.  I want to help people Evolve and Change Their Lives.

Help Evolve By Sharing

Contributing is helpful but spreading the word is just as important.  Share our project on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or email and help us spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

We are a team of young cylicsts from the Katutura, Namibia: Lucky, Jo Joe and Fiffy. We are headed off to world class UCI training camp in Potchefstroom, South Africa-- the hub for cycling in Africa! We are a part of the Physically Active Youth, a holistic after school programme which uses education and sports to help decrease juvenile crime, teenage sexual activity and substance abuse. In this way, P.A.Y. contributes a great deal towards positively shaping the lives of underpriviliged youth. Helping us means not only facilitating our sports careers but helping advance the cause of this after school centre. You can learn more about this amazing programme here:

What We Need 

Our trip has been funded through Namibian Cycling Federation and by P.A.Y. and it covers accommodation, food and cycling equipment for the 45 days of camp. However we require pocket money, approx. 150 EUR each. This is 3 x 150 = 450 EUR. The funds will go into our daily needs not covered by the camp.

The Impact

We are a team of cyclists competing against the odds. Just a year ago, we didn't exist as a team. In the meantime, we have won a number of races nationally, competed internationally and we now have the chance to crown this amazing year by attending the camp whicih may mean the start of our professional career. Moreover, as the first elite team produced within the P.A.Y. cycling project, we are a role models for approximately 100 learners who take part in the Physically Active Youth programme. We want to show those kids that hard work pays off and that they can take charge of their future.

How to make a contribution?

The easiest way to donate money is via Paypal to the following email address: pay.katutura@gmail.com. 

Or directly to the bank account of Physically Active Youth:

Standard Bank, Namibia 

Account name: PAY Program No. 2

Account number: 241504988  SWIFT code: SBNMNANX.

Purpose: For PAY cyclists UCI training camp


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise!

We P(L)AY forward!
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are a team of young cylicsts from the Katutura, Namibia: Lucky, Jo Joe and Fiffy. We are headed off to world class UCI training camp in Potchefstroom, South Africa-- the hub for cycling in Africa! We are a part of the Physically Active Youth, a holistic after school programme which uses education and sports to help decrease juvenile crime, teenage sexual activity and substance abuse. In this way, P.A.Y. contributes a great deal towards positively shaping the lives of underpriviliged youth. Helping us means not only facilitating our sports careers but helping advance the cause of this after school centre. You can learn more about this amazing programme here:



What We Need 
Our trip has been funded through Namibian Cycling Federation and by P.A.Y. and it covers accommodation, food and cycling equipment for the 45 days of camp. However we require pocket money, approx. 150 EUR each. This is 3 x 150 = 450 EUR. The funds will go into our daily needs not covered by the camp.


The Impact
We are a team of cyclists competing against the odds. Just a year ago, we didn't exist as a team. In the meantime, we have won a number of races nationally, competed internationally and we now have the chance to crown this amazing year by attending the camp whicih may mean the start of our professional career. Moreover, as the first elite team produced within the P.A.Y. cycling project, we are a role models for approximately 100 learners who take part in the Physically Active Youth programme. We want to show those kids that hard work pays off and that they can take charge of their future.



How to make a contribution?The easiest way to donate money is via Paypal to the following email address: pay.katutura@gmail.com. Or directly to the bank account of Physically Active Youth:
Standard Bank, Namibia 
Account name: PAY Program No. 2
Account number: 241504988  SWIFT code: SBNMNANX.
Purpose: For PAY cyclists UCI training camp


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise!
We P(L)AY forward!

story:
Krysia NEEDS YOUR HELP!

Time is running out!  Now is the time to help Krysia get her video off the ground by pre-purchasing one of the many rewards she has listed on the right.  How does this work?  Its simple, pre purchase any item(s) to the right and once we finishing filming, you will receive the reward(s) you selected.  We have worked very hard to keep the prices low for you and Krysia, but Krysia needs to raise her funds before filming!  If you want to purchase a video, do NOT wait until after the filming.  Simply put, the success of the filming relies on what we raise.  Don't worry though, we are guaranteeing all purchases made (meaning we will still satisfy your reward or you'll receive a full refund).

Do you want to buy more than one item but don't know how?  Simply select your highest dollar amount item and change your price to reflect the additional items you want to purchase.  Leave a comment or email me at shannonbaker@sb-productions.com with what all you want added.  We will make sure you get everything you order.

Time is running out, please spread the word!  Thank you to all that have contributed already, you are making Krysia's dreams come true!
 

Krysia Energy Power Yoga

Yoga is an unconditional home that is always there for you, whether you’re feeling up or down – no matter where you are emotionally that day.  I truly believe that yoga slows the whirlings of the mind, and breaks the patterns of those repetitive, and often toxic, thoughts that can dominate the mind. Even if you come to yoga only with the intention of getting a great sweat and workout, (which admittedly was the case for me when I first started all those years ago), these benefits will come.  My Power Yoga practice is a great heat-producing, energy exerting practice that will prepare your body for seated meditation. Yet these instructions are not commands, and I always emphasize the need to honor your body. You cannot be more gentle and kind to others until you are more gentle and kind to yourself.


I have been teaching classes for over 10 years and have guided hundreds of students across the country in Ashtanga Vinyasa yoga practice since 2003.  I teach because I want to share this experience with others, and through this video, I can provide that “home” to those that can’t make it to a class due to any number of circumstances. 


The money raised in this project will fund the filming and full production of this video.  Without full backing, my dream of expanding and sharing my experience through this video, will not come true.  Should we be successful, I have already secured a production company to produce the video: SB Productions.  They are helping me navigate through Indiegogo to achieve the funding I need for production and distribution.  Together, we have already secured a fantastic location in downtown Cleveland and have recruited the help of several friends as extras in the video!  We are reviewing the music selection, and I am also working with a professional photographer they have on staff to create some wonderful artistic pose prints.  I am so excited to be working with such a professional crew and can’t wait to share my video with everyone!

story:
Joy Gravley is totally disabled by multiple sclerosis and is completely wheelchair dependent.
Her husband Dana Gravley (her primary caregiver) has stage 4 neuroendocrine cancer. He had half of his left lung removed in early 2011 and continues to receive monthly treatments for inoperable tumors in his spine and femur.
They are unable to leave the house together to visit family members, go to doctor visits, go out to eat, or even enjoy something as simple as a trip to the movies with their 3 grandsons!

As things currently stand, Joy is totally unable to leave her house!!!

They are in DESPERATE need of a modern handicap acessible van !
The fundraiser goal amount would help towards the purchase a nice used handicap accessible conversion van.

If we can raise more to afford a NEW one, that would be amazing!!!!

Please watch the video above to get a short glimpse of their story and please help in any way possible!

Help spread the word!

Let's make a difference in the lives of this selfless, loving couple!!!
Thanks SO much for the love and support!

As things currently stand, Joy is totally unable to leave her house!!! They are in DESPERATE need of a modern handicap acessible van ! The fundraiser goal amount would help towards the purchase a nice used handicap accessible conversion van.  If we can raise more to afford a NEW one, that would be amazing!!!!Please watch the video above to get a short glimpse of their story and please help in any way possible! Help spread the word! story:
My name is Bob Slade and I really need your help. I have basil cell carcinoma (skin cancer) I'm 57 years old and have no health insurance. My wife is self employed so we have no insurance. I lost my job three years ago and times have been tough. We still have two children at home and because I haven't worked we have so many bills, it's mind boggling and very stressful for me and my wife. We have two mortgages that we are behind on and close to foreclosure. We raised our kids in this house and don't want to ever lose it. It's not the greatest house but it's our home. We are good people with great children just having a really hard time right now.

How you can help..

It's been very hard for me to find work, I'm 57 with no college degree. I think some employers don't want to hire me because of my appearance. I can tell by the way they look at my head and it's very embarrassing sometimes. I should have got this taken care of years ago but I was just trying to support my family and they just grow so fast (the children). I really need two operations which will cost at least $17,000 probably more with anesthesia and other costs. I feel if I could get the operations I'd feel better and look a lot better and could get a job so we don't lose our home. Anything you can send in will help and I would be very grateful. Thank you for reading this, it wasn't easy to write and I hate to ask people I don't even know for money but I'm desperate.
                              

                                           Thank you,
                                                                                         Bob Slade

story:
In 2006 I spent 2 months in India.  Most of that time was spent with a man named Rahul Wali, operator of Nature Quest India in the village of Than Gaon.  Nature Quest is the home for a medical clinic and childrens school.  The Than Gaon Medical Clinic is staffed by one local physician and two or three volunteers at a time.  The clinic will treat residents of Than Gaon, although there are many who cannot make the trip to the village of Than Gaon let alone the closest city of Dehra Dun.  The clinic staff most days of the week travel 2-3 hours by foot to neighboring villages, treating  children and those who cannot travel.  The childrens school at Than Gaon takes pride in its 46 students, studying english, health and giving them hope as they prepare for the future.  

My friend Rahul and I speak on the telephone a couple important days of the year, Christmas/ Birthdays, but recently he called and asked if I was able to help.  This is the first time in 6 years Rahul has asked for anything.  He told me the clinic needs simple medications and supplies, ranging from pediatric vitamins to gloves and medical tape.  I told Rahul that I would speak to my friends, family and co-workers to see if there is anything we could contribute.    

It is my goal to raise one thousand dollars by May 20th.  This money will then be sent to a co-workers family member in Delhi who owns a pharmacy.  The supplies will be picked up by Rahul and taken 7 hours north to Than Gaon.  If done this way we can save money on shipping supplies and cheaper medication prices in Delhi.  

The thousand dollar goal needs to be met by May 20th, if it is not, all contributions will be returned in full.  Please help by spreading the word and gving what you can.  

 

Thank you to everyone, 

 

Matthew Hepler

story:
Our Story

A close friend of mine suffered from hodgkin's lymphoma as a child and I was so inspired by her story that I decided to shave my head, as a public event, in order to raise money for hodgkin's lymphoma research. It is like the St. Baldrick's events, but not affiliated for various reasons however all of the proceeds will go straight to them.


The Impact

If I don't raise the amount of money indicated, I will have failed a cohort so desperately in need. Please help me provide those affected by hodgkin's lymphoma with a symbol of hope.


What We Need & What You Get

ALL PROCEEDS WILL GO TO ST. BALDRICKS, DIRECT CHECK  AFTER THE EVENT and you get the satisfaction that comes from helping those in need.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to donate here, you can donate directly to the St. Baldrick's web address itself and help those children. Please either come to this event in New Canaan, CT outside the New Canaan Playhouse (movie theatre) or donate some money to help fund research.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Jackson Hogan. I have a passion to help people, from young kids at school to professional athletes. I want to develop a program to help everyone around the world become better at the sport they play or compete in. I will help them develop the skill and techniques to run faster and be better at the sport they play and assist them in reaching their goals. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to develop a special program that will help anyone regardless of skill level, techniques that will assist them in reaching their goals. The program will assist them with:

- Exercises to develop explosive power

- Nutrition plans

- Warm up / Warm Down / Recovery Techniques

- Positive Mental Attitudes

We want to help everyone in the community achieve their goals, the funds will support:

- Website / Forum Development with Interactive Modules

- Specific Nutrition Plans

- Camera / IT Equipment

- Expert Advice

- I will help them develop the skill and techniques to run faster and be better at the sport they play and assist them in reaching their goals. 

The Impact

Since I was 9 years old, I have always been the person that wanted to help my friends and team mates become the athlete they always dreamed of. I love helping people get the most out of their abilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

And that’s all there is to it. Please help us, help others.

story:
As a birthday gift to an amazing girl, we have decide to try and help her support something she believes in. As a teenager, she struggled with addiction and through the help of a Teen Challenge Rehab Center in West Virginia she was able to rediscover her faith and get sober. Since graduating from her program she has wanted to give back to this center that has given her a new life. On her birthday, We are hoping to make a donation in her name to the facility that helped her. This donation will go to helping others who are struggling with addiction to get the help that they need. As Teen Challenge is a non-profit organization, it could use some extra funding to continue to help those struggling with addiction. We are doing this without her knowledge as we plan on surprising her with the donation on her birthday. Thanks for your support!

To read more about Teen Challenge you can visit this site: http://teenchallengecares.org/

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of 4 people that set out to build the best travel app you could think of. 
Uri, Vol's CEO, at 31, has traveled the world in business & first class for free by using his airline miles.
Yoni, Vol's CTO, at 28, is the one in charge of building the app. 
Sagiv, Vol's COO, at 30, is the one connecting VOL to the outside world.
Rami, Vol's chief architect, at 29, is the one overseeing this whole computational extravaganza! 
My name is Uri, I graduated from medical school, (yep, a real doctor :) and have always been in love with airplanes. I also love flying in style but never had the money to pay for it. Enter frequent flyer programs- where you can use your airline miles to fly for free. That's what our app - Vol is doing. 
We at Vol think it's important to help people use their airline miles. Today, only 20% or so of frequent flyers ever use them airline miles and put them to good use (that is redeeming for award travel). 
If you guys help us, we can spread the word to even more people so they can use their airline miles and we'll make our app even better (though with all due respect, it's pretty awesome as is :)
Send over some change and we promise you to fly the cheapest way available, better than any online fare you'll find since you're FINALLY using them airline miles you have!
The official launching of Vol will take place on October 10th!
In the meantime, download the beta version of Vol here:
https://itunes.apple.com/il/app/vol-the-travel-app/id1080190529?mt=8
Visit and like our Facebook page here:
https://www.facebook.com/voltravelapp/?fref=ts
What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for funding so we can support our servers, and improve our user experience of the app. These two do cost quite a bit but we also need money for advertising. (Uri thought of getting Jerry Seinfeld but he never responded, heck we offered him % of the company, oh well). 

Besides Vol booking your award flight and flying for free in a SUPER easy process (everything is done through the app), we promise additional features like telling you where you can fly for free based on the amount of airline miles you have and hopefully even offering you to donate your miles to charity, helping children who need surgery for example, to fly to their hospital for treatment (we don't have that up yet though). 

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds still go into the company. Basically every dollar is going into the company- whether it's for development or marketing. 

The Impact

We plan on changing the world of frequent flyers and bringing to the general public the capability to book flights for free using their airline miles. 

We really believe in what we're doing and we really love the industry. I mean, if our CEO could have lived in an airplane, he probably would have. There's no reason why people should abandon their airline miles and we're here to help them use them. You can contact Uri directly at Uri@Vol-Travel.com for any questions, I promise to get back to you ASAP. 

Uri is a real pro in earning and burning airline/hotel miles and will gladly help you regardless if you download our app. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • It's cool if you don't want to donate, but we would really appreciate your feedback if you download our app :)

And that's all there is to it, thanks for your time reading this. 

Uri

CEO @ Vol

Feel free to contact us directly @:

Uri@Vol-Travel.com

story:
Who Are We

Marah ThinkLIFE Inc. (www.mthinklife.org) is a 501(c)(3), tax-deductible, non-profit organization whose mission is to compassionately and professionally provide free basketball camps combined with personal and professional development training to young men in order to positively influence culture. 

That's the technical part.

The organic part is that we are an organization founded by five young men who were nurtured by the Christ-centered love of their small, low-income community in North Carolina and want to share that love with the rest of the world.  In sharing that love we believe that we have an obligation to that same small community.  It is also an obligation to make that love known to the rest of the world.  Along with the fundamentals of basketball we teach young men basic principles of love, intellect, faith, and emancipation and how those principles apply to basic personal finance, how to respond to peer pressure, creating positive peer influence, how to nurture a positive self-image and much more. We also believe we are building other men who will take our momentum and carry it forward.


Our shared love for sport, particularly basketball, is our primary teaching tool. The Marah LIFE: LIFE & Basketball Skills Camps are the perfect way to teach life principles (rooted in Christ's teachings of the principles of love, intellect, faith, and emancipation) in a way that is engaging to young men.  In our eyes basketball is the best sport for teaching what it means to be not only a man, but a loving, intelligent, faithful, free human being.

By contributing to our campaign you are able to directly influence culture.  You can actively participate in changing depressing statistics concerning young men and their perceived propensity toward negativity.  Your contribution assists us in the work of building boys into young men from the inside out.  It is your opportunity to be the change YOU want to see in the world.

What We're Asking of You

Our mission is to provide these camps FREE to all attendees.  For planning and expense reasons we typically cap enrollment at 35 campers.  Even though we provide the camps free to the participants, we have to pay for lodging (2 nights and 3 days), meals, camp t-shirts, transportation, equipment, classroom space and all the other expenses that are required to provide a top-flight basketball camp experience that would easily run campers $200-$300 at typical basketball camps.

Our largest expenses are facility rental (lodging, classroom space, gymnasium, etc.) and meals for campers and volunteers which typically cost us approximately $3,500. We hold camp at the marvelous grounds of Camp Oak Hill in  beautiful Oak Hill, NC and they have made every camp well worth the cost through their assistance and hospitality.


Our next highest expense is t-shirts for approximately 35 campers and 20 volunteers which usually cost us $400-$500.  

Often our campers from the Triangle (Raleigh, Durham, Chapel-Hill) region of NC don't have the means to travel out to Oak Hill.  For this reason we provide transportation from Raleigh.  We also have to transport all equipment from various locations for the weekend.  This costs usually comes in at about $300-$400.

Any funds that remain after expenses are re-invested in supporting the next camp. No one in our organization, whether staff or volunteer, receives any monetary compensation.  

The Impact

Being in our fourth successful year of this service we have heard numerous stories from parents, teachers, churches, and other community members of how we positively affect the young men who attend our camps.

Some responses from pre- and post-camp surveys of parents and camp attendees include that their young men are more apt to express desire for positions of leadership in their community, are more engaged in academic achievement, and are even more respectful and helpful in the home.  As we continue to grow we are currently developing more concrete metrics for measuring our impact on campers' academic performance, community service, and other key areas of development.


Other Ways You Can Help

As a non-profit we are more aware than most of the financial challenges our economy is facing.   We also recognize that many people who desire to show their love through monetary contributions may not financially be in a position to do so.

We completely understand.  
So, some other ways you can help if you are not able to contribute directly would be:
  • speak to your church about the potential of contributing to our service
  • speak to the leadership at your place of business and ask them to consider contributing or partnering with us
  • take some time to pray for us and/or send us positive thoughts
  • contact us to discuss volunteering at camp
  • visit our website to become more familiar with us (www.mthinklife.org)
  • use the Indiegogo social media sharing tools to help spread the word
story_txt:
Who Are We
Marah ThinkLIFE Inc. (www.mthinklife.org) is a 501(c)(3), tax-deductible, non-profit organization whose mission is to compassionately and professionally provide free basketball camps combined with personal and professional development training to young men in order to positively influence culture. 
That's the technical part.
The organic part is that we are an organization founded by five young men who were nurtured by the Christ-centered love of their small, low-income community in North Carolina and want to share that love with the rest of the world.  In sharing that love we believe that we have an obligation to that same small community.  It is also an obligation to make that love known to the rest of the world.  Along with the fundamentals of basketball we teach young men basic principles of love, intellect, faith, and emancipation and how those principles apply to basic personal finance, how to respond to peer pressure, creating positive peer influence, how to nurture a positive self-image and much more. We also believe we are building other men who will take our momentum and carry it forward.
Our shared love for sport, particularly basketball, is our primary teaching tool. The Marah LIFE: LIFE & Basketball Skills Camps are the perfect way to teach life principles (rooted in Christ's teachings of the principles of love, intellect, faith, and emancipation) in a way that is engaging to young men.  In our eyes basketball is the best sport for teaching what it means to be not only a man, but a loving, intelligent, faithful, free human being.
By contributing to our campaign you are able to directly influence culture.  You can actively participate in changing depressing statistics concerning young men and their perceived propensity toward negativity.  Your contribution assists us in the work of building boys into young men from the inside out.  It is your opportunity to be the change YOU want to see in the world.


What We're Asking of You

Our mission is to provide these camps FREE to all attendees.  For planning and expense reasons we typically cap enrollment at 35 campers.  Even though we provide the camps free to the participants, we have to pay for lodging (2 nights and 3 days), meals, camp t-shirts, transportation, equipment, classroom space and all the other expenses that are required to provide a top-flight basketball camp experience that would easily run campers $200-$300 at typical basketball camps.Our largest expenses are facility rental (lodging, classroom space, gymnasium, etc.) and meals for campers and volunteers which typically cost us approximately $3,500. We hold camp at the marvelous grounds of Camp Oak Hill in  beautiful Oak Hill, NC and they have made every camp well worth the cost through their assistance and hospitality.
Our next highest expense is t-shirts for approximately 35 campers and 20 volunteers which usually cost us $400-$500.  
Often our campers from the Triangle (Raleigh, Durham, Chapel-Hill) region of NC don't have the means to travel out to Oak Hill.  For this reason we provide transportation from Raleigh.  We also have to transport all equipment from various locations for the weekend.  This costs usually comes in at about $300-$400.

Any funds that remain after expenses are re-invested in supporting the next camp. No one in our organization, whether staff or volunteer, receives any monetary compensation.  


The ImpactBeing in our fourth successful year of this service we have heard numerous stories from parents, teachers, churches, and other community members of how we positively affect the young men who attend our camps.Some responses from pre- and post-camp surveys of parents and camp attendees include that their young men are more apt to express desire for positions of leadership in their community, are more engaged in academic achievement, and are even more respectful and helpful in the home.  As we continue to grow we are currently developing more concrete metrics for measuring our impact on campers' academic performance, community service, and other key areas of development.



Other Ways You Can Help
As a non-profit we are more aware than most of the financial challenges our economy is facing.   We also recognize that many people who desire to show their love through monetary contributions may not financially be in a position to do so. We completely understand.  
So, some other ways you can help if you are not able to contribute directly would be:

speak to your church about the potential of contributing to our service
speak to the leadership at your place of business and ask them to consider contributing or partnering with us
take some time to pray for us and/or send us positive thoughts
contact us to discuss volunteering at camp
visit our website to become more familiar with us (www.mthinklife.org)
use the Indiegogo social media sharing tools to help spread the word

story:
The reason

Mercury poisoning affects thousands of people. Many victims are too poor to help themselves. I am working towards the elimination of mercury use in small-scale gold mining (mostly illegal) in my home country, Indonesia, and in other countries. In the last 10 years, the world has witnessed an increasing number of  people suffering from mercury poisoning in gold mining hotspots-- many were not even gold miners but family members. This reminds me of the unresolved Minamata tragedy in Japan in the 1950s which brought tears to my eyes.

For my 50th birthday, I am launching a campaign that could help these innocent victims. Many are unaware that they are suffering from mercury poisoning because some of the symptoms are similar to more common diseases such as malaria and dengue fever. Drugs and treatments are available to help them, but proper assessment must first be carried out by trained health workers. 


The plan 

My plan is to support victims in remote villages by providing nurses to help assess, treat and monitor their health. These villages are strewn with gold-processing facilities and gold shops that use the mercury. 

The fund will be appropriately divided between assessment and treatment. For this project, I am planning to help 50 people from a number of villages in West Java and Lombok to get the correct medication for 12 months.

In order to do this, I need $30,000. This includes the cost to pay the nurses over the 12 months period ($3,051), their transport ($2,034), and for the medicine ($24,915).


Why you should donate

Mercury poisoning is a type of metal poisoning caused by exposure to mercury (direct or indirect). Almost all small-scale gold mines in developing countries use mercury to separate gold from other metals. The miners do not usually wear protective equipment when handling the mercury, which can cause it to be absorbed by the skin and enter their bloodstream. Once mercury is in a persons blood, there is no way to get it out. The body does not have a natural mechanism that allows mercury to be excreted from the body. 
Mercury in the air can travel distances. It can poison neighbouring villages-- including children and pregnant mothers. It can also enter water and soil which can quickly poison the food chain. 
Mercury poisoning can damage the brain, kidneys, lungs, digestive system, and motor system. It is one of the least understood diseases, especially since the symptoms are hard to tell apart from malaria and dengue fever. The victims desperately need proper medical assessment leading to effective treatment.

    Other ways you can help

    If you could please help get the word out by sharing this link I would be most grateful. 
    I believe that everyone has the right to live in a healthy and safe environment, regardless of their age and social status.
    Thank you for your help.
    Yuyun Ismawati

story:
Why am I doing this?

As I come close to knocking on number 50's door, I find there are many things that I would like to achieve. One of these is to participate in, and complete, a running race. I have signed up to run a 10K race in July at Chelmsford. By marathon standards, this many not seem very far, but believe me, it is. The cause that I am supporting is one that is extremely worthwhile. Although the "pink army" would suggest supporting female forms of cancer, Cancer UK researches all types of cancer, male or female. It would be fantastic if I could raise lots, and also would give me incentive to get out there and continue training, and inspire me to finish the race. Thank you for your support.

Sarah
